That means I rely a lot on \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcourses.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fcourses\u002Ftableau-2-0?utm_source=blog&amp;utm_medium=6-data-visualization-python-libraries\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003Edata visualization\u003C\u002Fa\u003E to explore the dataset I&#8217;m working on.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EAnd I couldn&#8217;t relate more to Ben Shneiderman&#8217;s quote! Data visualization gives me answers to questions I hadn&#8217;t even considered before. After all, \u003Cstrong\u003Ea picture is worth a thousand data points\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E!\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThis naturally leads to the million-dollar question &#8211; which \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcourses.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fcourses\u002Fintroduction-to-data-science?utm_source=blog&amp;utm_medium=6-data-visualization-python-libraries\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003EPython\u003C\u002Fa\u003E library should you use for data visualization? There are quite a few across the board. Even seasoned data scientists can get lost in the myriad sea of features that each Python library has to offer.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Ca rel=\"lightbox\" href=https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F03\u002Fdata-viz-tools.jpg\u003E\u003Cimg class=\"aligncenter wp-image-63178 size-full\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F03\u002Fdata-viz-tools.jpg\" alt=\"data visualization python\" width=\"1050\" height=\"520\" srcset=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F03\u002Fdata-viz-tools.jpg 1050w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F03\u002Fdata-viz-tools-300x149.jpg 300w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F03\u002Fdata-viz-tools-768x380.jpg 768w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F03\u002Fdata-viz-tools-850x421.jpg 850w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1050px) 100vw, 1050px\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThat&#8217;s why I wanted to write this article espousing the advantages and unique features of the different data visualization Python libraries. We will cover some of the most amazing libraries for visualization that Python supports. Each of these libraries possesses its own flair and is really useful for a particular kind of visualization task.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003ESo without much ado, let&#8217;s start!\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cem\u003EIf you&#8217;re new to Python and\u002For data visualization, I suggest checking out the below resources by Analytics Vidhya:\u003C\u002Fem\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cul\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003E\u003Cem\u003E\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcourses.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fcourses\u002Fintroduction-to-data-science?utm_source=blog&amp;utm_medium=6-data-visualization-python-libraries\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003EPython for Data Science\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fem\u003E\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003E\u003Cem\u003E\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcourses.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fcourses\u002Ftableau-2-0?utm_source=blog&amp;utm_medium=6-data-visualization-python-libraries\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003EMastering Tableau from Scratch: Become a Data Visualization Rockstar\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fem\u003E\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Ch2\u003EThe 6 Data Visualization Python Libraries We&#8217;ll Cover\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\n\u003Col\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003EMatplotlib\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003ESeaborn\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003EBokeh\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003EAltair\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003EPlotly\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003Eggplot\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fol\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Ch2\u003E1. Matplotlib\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cimg class=\"aligncenter wp-image-63177 size-medium\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F03\u002Fmatplotlib-300x72.png\" alt=\"\" width=\"300\" height=\"72\" srcset=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F03\u002Fmatplotlib-300x72.png 300w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F03\u002Fmatplotlib-768x184.png 768w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F03\u002Fmatplotlib-850x204.png 850w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F03\u002Fmatplotlib.png 1200w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EChances are you&#8217;ve already used matplotlib in your data science journey. From beginners in data science to experienced professionals building complex data visualizations, matplotlib is usually the default visualization Python library data scientists turn to.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003Ematplotlib is known for the high amount of flexibility it provides as a 2-D plotting library in Python. If you have a MATLAB programming background, you&#8217;ll find the Pyplot interface of Matplotlib very familiar. You&#8217;ll be off with your first visualization in no time at all!\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Ch3\u003EUnique features of Matplotlib\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EMatplotlib can be used in multiple ways in Python, including Python scripts, the Python and iPython shells, Jupyter Notebooks and what not! This is why it&#8217;s often used to create visualizations not just by Data Scientists but also by researchers to create graphs that are of publication quality.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EMatplotlib supports all the popular charts (lots, histograms, power spectra, bar charts, error charts, scatterplots, etc.) right out of the box. There are also extensions that you can use to create advanced visualizations like 3-Dimensional plots, etc.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Ca rel=\"lightbox\" href=https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F03\u002Fezgif.com-webp-to-png.png\u003E\u003Cimg class=\"aligncenter wp-image-63180 size-full\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F03\u002Fezgif.com-webp-to-png.png\" alt=\"data visualization python\" width=\"640\" height=\"480\" srcset=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F03\u002Fezgif.com-webp-to-png.png 640w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F03\u002Fezgif.com-webp-to-png-300x225.png 300w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F03\u002Fezgif.com-webp-to-png-83x63.png 83w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 640px) 100vw, 640px\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EWhat I personally like about matplotlib is that because it&#8217;s so flexible, it lets the user control aspects of the visualization at the most granular level, from a single line or dot in the graph to the entire chart. This means you can customize it at the highest levels.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Ch3\u003ETutorial(s) to learn matplotlib\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EHere are some useful tutorials to learn matplotlib:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cul\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003E\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fblog\u002F2020\u002F02\u002Fbeginner-guide-matplotlib-data-visualization-exploration-python\u002F?utm_source=blog&amp;utm_medium=6-data-visualization-python-libraries\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003EA Beginner’s Guide to matplotlib for Data Visualization and Exploration in Python\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003E\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fmatplotlib.org\u002Fusers\u002Findex.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003Ematplotlib Official Documentation\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EHere&#8217;s Matplotlib&#8217;s creator giving an introductory tutorial:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Ccenter\u003E\u003Ciframe title=\"matplotlib: Lessons from middle age.\" width=\"500\" height=\"375\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.youtube.com\u002Fembed\u002Fe3lTby5RI54?feature=oembed\" frameborder=\"0\" allow=\"accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture\" allowfullscreen\u003E\u003C\u002Fiframe\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003C\u002Fcenter\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Ch2\u003E2. Seaborn\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EWhen I look at visualizations built by Seaborn, only one word comes to mind &#8211; beautiful! Seaborn is built on top of matplotlib and provides a very simple yet intuitive interface for building visualizations. When using Seaborn, you will also notice that many of the default settings in the plots work quite well right out of the box.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Ch3\u003EUnique features of Seaborn\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThe first unique feature of Seaborn is that it is designed in such a way that you write way lesser code to achieve high-grade visualizations. Here is an example of this simplicity. Notice how we can create a complex visualization with just a single line of plotting code:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Ca rel=\"lightbox\" href=https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F03\u002FScreenshot-from-2020-03-04-07-39-44.png\u003E\u003Cimg class=\"aligncenter wp-image-63181 size-full\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F03\u002FScreenshot-from-2020-03-04-07-39-44.png\" alt=\"data visualization python\" width=\"872\" height=\"738\" srcset=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F03\u002FScreenshot-from-2020-03-04-07-39-44.png 872w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F03\u002FScreenshot-from-2020-03-04-07-39-44-300x254.png 300w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F03\u002FScreenshot-from-2020-03-04-07-39-44-768x650.png 768w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F03\u002FScreenshot-from-2020-03-04-07-39-44-850x719.png 850w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 872px) 100vw, 872px\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp style=\"text-align: center;\"\u003E\u003Cem\u003E\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fseaborn.pydata.org\u002Fexamples\u002Fscatter_bubbles.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003ESource: Seaborn\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fem\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThe second useful feature of Seaborn is that it supports a plethora of advanced plots like categorical plotting (catplot), distribution plotting using kde (distplot), swarm plot, etc. right out of the box. And of course, we saw one example of \u003Cstrong\u003Erelplot\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E above.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003ENow, because Seaborn is built on top of matplotlib, it is highly compatible with it. So that means when building visualizations, you can start with advanced plots that seaborn already supports and then customize them as much as you want with the help of matplotlib.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Ch3\u003ETutorial(s) to learn Seaborn\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EHere are some helpful resources that you can utilize to start using the seaborn library for data visualization:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cul\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003E\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fblog\u002F2019\u002F09\u002Fcomprehensive-data-visualization-guide-seaborn-python\u002F?utm_source=blog&amp;utm_medium=6-data-visualization-python-libraries\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003EBecome a Data Visualization Whiz with this Comprehensive Guide to Seaborn in Python\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003E\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fseaborn.pydata.org\u002Ftutorial.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003ESeaborn Official Documentation\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Ch2\u003E3. Bokeh\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EBokeh is a library designed to generate visualizations that are friendly on the web interface and browsers. And that&#8217;s what this visualization library specifically targets.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Ca rel=\"lightbox\" href=https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F03\u002FBokeh-Logo-Twitter.png\u003E\u003Cimg class=\"aligncenter wp-image-63183 size-full\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F03\u002FBokeh-Logo-Twitter.png\" alt=\"data visualization python\" width=\"300\" height=\"300\" srcset=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F03\u002FBokeh-Logo-Twitter.png 300w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F03\u002FBokeh-Logo-Twitter-150x150.png 150w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F03\u002FBokeh-Logo-Twitter-200x200.png 200w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EYou will also notice that the visualizations generated from Bokeh are interactive in nature, which basically means you can convey information in a more intuitive way through your plots.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Ch3\u003EUnique features of Bokeh\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EBokeh supports unique visualizations like Geospatial plots, Network graphs, etc. right out of the box. If you want to show these visualizations in a browser, there are options available to export them and you can also use it through \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fblog\u002F2019\u002F06\u002Fbuild-machine-learning-model-in-your-browser-tensorflow-js-deeplearn-js\u002F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003EJavaScript\u003C\u002Fa\u003E itself!\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Ch3\u003ETutorial to learn Bokeh\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EHere is a nice tutorial to learn Bokeh for data visualization:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cul\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003E\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fblog\u002F2015\u002F08\u002Finteractive-data-visualization-library-python-bokeh\u002F?utm_source=blog&amp;utm_medium=6-data-visualization-python-libraries\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003EInteractive Data Visualization using Bokeh (in Python)\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Ch2\u003E4. Altair\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cimg class=\"size-full wp-image-63184 aligncenter\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F03\u002Faltair-logo-light.png\" alt=\"\" width=\"200\" height=\"200\" srcset=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F03\u002Faltair-logo-light.png 200w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F03\u002Faltair-logo-light-150x150.png 150w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 200px) 100vw, 200px\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EAltair is a declarative library for data visualization. Its principle is that rather than focusing on the code part, one should focus on the visualization part and write as less code as possible and still be able to create beautiful and intuitive plots. That&#8217;s right down my alley!\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Ch3\u003EUnique features of Altair\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003ESince Altair uses a declarative style to create plots, it becomes very easy and quick to iterate through visualizations and experiments at a rapid pace when using this library.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Ch3\u003ETutorial(s) to learn Altair\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EHere is a good introduction to Altair in Python:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cul\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003E\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fblog\u002F2017\u002F12\u002Fintroduction-to-altair-a-declarative-visualization-in-python\u002F?utm_source=blog&amp;utm_medium=6-data-visualization-python-libraries\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003EIntroduction to Altair – A Declarative Visualization Library in Python\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003E\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Faltair-viz.github.io\u002F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003EAltair Documentation\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Ch2\u003E5. Plotly\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThe first thing that comes to my mind when I think about Plotly is interactivity! This data visualization library is by far my go-to library whenever I want to create visualizations that need to be highly interactive for the user.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EJust check out this visualization created using Plotly:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Ca rel=\"lightbox\" href=https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F03\u002F687474703a2f2f692e696d6775722e636f6d2f643379346e776d2e676966.gif\u003E\u003Cimg class=\"aligncenter wp-image-63185 size-full\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F03\u002F687474703a2f2f692e696d6775722e636f6d2f643379346e776d2e676966.gif\" alt=\"data visualization python\" width=\"1274\" height=\"598\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Ch3\u003EUnique features of Plotly\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EPlotly is highly compatible with Jupyter Notebook and Web Browsers. This means whatever interactive plots you create can easily be shared in the same manner with your teammates or end-users.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EI also want to point out that Plotly supports a gamut of plots right from basic chart types, Seaborn-like beautiful and advanced plots, 3-D plots, Map-based visualizations, scientific plots, etc. The list is endless!\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EPlotly&#8217;s plots can also support animation capabilities as well. So, it&#8217;s a pretty useful library if you want to do storytelling through visualizations.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Ch3\u003ETutorial to learn Plotly\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EHere are a couple of tutorials to get you up and running with Plotly for data visualization:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cul\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003E\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fblog\u002F2017\u002F01\u002Fbeginners-guide-to-create-beautiful-interactive-data-visualizations-using-plotly-in-r-and-python\u002F?utm_source=blog&amp;utm_medium=6-data-visualization-python-libraries\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003EHow to Create Beautiful, Interactive data visualizations using Plotly in R and Python?\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003E\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fplot.ly\u002Fpython\u002F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003EPlotly Documentation\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Ch2\u003E6. ggplot\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Ca rel=\"lightbox\" href=https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F03\u002Fggplot.png\u003E\u003Cimg class=\"aligncenter wp-image-63187 size-full\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F03\u002Fggplot.png\" alt=\"data visualization python\" width=\"240\" height=\"278\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003Eggplot is the Python version of the famous ggplot2 of R and the Grammer of Graphics language. If you have used it in R before, you will know just how simple it is to create plots using this library.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EI personally love the flexibility of ggplot. We can easily wrangle data while building plots on the fly &#8211; a super useful concept!\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Ch3\u003EUnique features of ggplot\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003Eggplot is also a declarative style library like Bokeh but is also tightly coupled with \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcourses.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fcourses\u002Fpandas-for-data-analysis-in-python\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003EPandas\u003C\u002Fa\u003E. This means you can easily build visualizations using your Pandas dataframe itself!\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Ch3\u003ETutorial(s) to learn ggplot\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EYou can learn more about ggplot and how to work with it here:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cul\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003E\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fblog\u002F2016\u002F03\u002Fquestions-ggplot2-package-r\u002F?utm_source=blog&amp;utm_medium=6-data-visualization-python-libraries\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003E10 Questions R Users Always Ask While Using ggplot2 Package\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003E\u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Fggplot.yhathq.com\u002Fhow-it-works.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003Eggplot Python Documentation\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Ch2\u003EEnd Notes\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EIn this article, we explored some of the must-know libraries for performing data visualization in Python. Each of these libraries is quite popular in its own right and shines out in different scenarios.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EI hope this article will be like a rosetta stone when you are going to decide which library to use for your next project.\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EDo you think any other data visualization library should be on this list? Did you like the article? There is no shortage of \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fblog\u002F2017\u002F09\u002Fcommon-machine-learning-algorithms\u002F?utm_source=blog&amp;utm_medium=cnn-vs-rnn-vs-mlp-analyzing-3-types-of-neural-networks-in-deep-learning\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003Emachine learning algorithms\u003C\u002Fa\u003E so why should a data scientist gravitate towards deep learning algorithms? What do neural networks offer that traditional machine learning algorithms don&#8217;t?\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EAnother common question I see floating around &#8211; neural networks require a ton of computing power, so is it really worth using them? While that question is laced with nuance, here&#8217;s the short answer &#8211; yes!\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EThe different types of neural networks in \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcourses.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fcourses\u002Fcomputer-vision-using-deep-learning-version2?utm_source=blog&amp;utm_medium=cnn-vs-rnn-vs-mlp-analyzing-3-types-of-neural-networks-in-deep-learning\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003Edeep learning\u003C\u002Fa\u003E, such as convolutional neural networks (CNN), recurrent neural networks (RNN), artificial neural networks (ANN), etc. are changing the way we interact with the world. These different types of neural networks are at the core of the deep learning revolution, powering applications like unmanned aerial vehicles, self-driving cars, speech recognition, etc.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Ca rel=\"lightbox\" href=https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2019\u002F05\u002Fman-nueral-network-red-.jpg\u003E\u003Cimg class=\"aligncenter size-full wp-image-51922\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2019\u002F05\u002Fman-nueral-network-red-.jpg\" alt=\"types of neural networks\" width=\"1020\" height=\"520\" srcset=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2019\u002F05\u002Fman-nueral-network-red-.jpg 1020w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2019\u002F05\u002Fman-nueral-network-red--300x153.jpg 300w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2019\u002F05\u002Fman-nueral-network-red--768x392.jpg 768w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2019\u002F05\u002Fman-nueral-network-red--850x433.jpg 850w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1020px) 100vw, 1020px\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EIt&#8217;s natural to wonder &#8211; can&#8217;t \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcourses.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fcourses\u002Fapplied-machine-learning-beginner-to-professional?utm_source=blog&amp;utm_medium=cnn-vs-rnn-vs-mlp-analyzing-3-types-of-neural-networks-in-deep-learning\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003Emachine learning\u003C\u002Fa\u003E algorithms do the same? Well, here are two key reasons why researchers and experts tend to prefer Deep Learning over Machine Learning:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cul\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003EDecision Boundary\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003EFeature Engineering\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003ECurious? Good &#8211; let me explain.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Ch3\u003E1. Machine Learning vs. Deep Learning: Decision Boundary\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EEvery Machine Learning algorithm learns the mapping from an input to output. In case of parametric models, the algorithm learns a function with a few sets of weights:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cblockquote\u003E\r\n\u003Cp style=\"text-align: center;\"\u003E        Input -&gt; f(w\u003Csub\u003E1\u003C\u002Fsub\u003E,w\u003Csub\u003E2\u003C\u002Fsub\u003E…..w\u003Csub\u003En\u003C\u002Fsub\u003E) -&gt; Output\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Fblockquote\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EIn the case of classification problems,  the algorithm learns the function that separates 2 classes &#8211; this is known as a \u003Cstrong\u003EDecision boundary\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E. A decision boundary helps us in determining whether a given data point belongs to a positive class or a negative class.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EFor example, in the case of \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fblog\u002F2015\u002F10\u002Fbasics-logistic-regression\u002F?utm_source=blog&amp;utm_medium=cnn-vs-rnn-vs-mlp-analyzing-3-types-of-neural-networks-in-deep-learning\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003Elogistic regression\u003C\u002Fa\u003E, the learning function is a Sigmoid function that tries to separate the 2 classes:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Ca rel=\"lightbox\" href=https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002Flogistic-regression-example-e1527081563263.jpg\u003E\u003Cimg class=\"wp-image-61686 size-full aligncenter\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002Flogistic-regression-example-e1527081563263.jpg\" alt=\"logistic regression\" width=\"457\" height=\"422\" srcset=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002Flogistic-regression-example-e1527081563263.jpg 457w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002Flogistic-regression-example-e1527081563263-300x277.jpg 300w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 457px) 100vw, 457px\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp style=\"text-align: center;\"\u003E\u003Cem\u003EDecision boundary of logistic regression\u003C\u002Fem\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EAs you can see here, the \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fblog\u002F2015\u002F10\u002Fbasics-logistic-regression\u002F?utm_source=blog&amp;utm_medium=cnn-vs-rnn-vs-mlp-analyzing-3-types-of-neural-networks-in-deep-learning\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003Elogistic regression algorithm\u003C\u002Fa\u003E learns the linear decision boundary. It cannot learn decision boundaries for nonlinear data like this one:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Ca rel=\"lightbox\" href=https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002FSVM-Kernel-Trick.png\u003E\u003Cimg class=\"wp-image-61688 size-full aligncenter\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002FSVM-Kernel-Trick.png\" alt=\"non linear\" width=\"237\" height=\"265\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp style=\"text-align: center;\"\u003E\u003Cem\u003ENonlinear data\u003C\u002Fem\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003ESimilarly, every Machine Learning algorithm is not capable of learning all the functions. This limits the problems these algorithms can solve that involve a complex relationship.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Ch3\u003E2. Machine Learning vs. Deep Learning: Feature Engineering\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EFeature engineering is a key step in the model building process. It is a two-step process:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Col\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EFeature extraction\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EFeature selection\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Fol\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EIn feature extraction, we extract all the required features for our problem statement and in feature selection, we select the important features that improve the performance of our machine learning or \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcourses.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fcourses\u002Fcomputer-vision-using-deep-learning-version2?utm_source=blog&amp;utm_medium=cnn-vs-rnn-vs-mlp-analyzing-3-types-of-neural-networks-in-deep-learning\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003Edeep learning\u003C\u002Fa\u003E model.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EConsider an \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fblog\u002F2019\u002F01\u002Fbuild-image-classification-model-10-minutes\u002F?utm_source=blog&amp;utm_medium=cnn-vs-rnn-vs-mlp-analyzing-3-types-of-neural-networks-in-deep-learning\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003Eimage classification\u003C\u002Fa\u003E problem. Extracting features manually from an image needs strong knowledge of the subject as well as the domain. It is an extremely time-consuming process. Thanks to Deep Learning, we can automate the process of Feature Engineering!\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Ca rel=\"lightbox\" href=https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002FDlPjv2iXcAAUi6X.jpg-large.jpeg\u003E\u003Cimg class=\"wp-image-61690 size-full aligncenter\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002FDlPjv2iXcAAUi6X.jpg-large.jpeg\" alt=\"deep learning feature engineering\" width=\"733\" height=\"405\" srcset=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002FDlPjv2iXcAAUi6X.jpg-large.jpeg 733w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002FDlPjv2iXcAAUi6X.jpg-large-300x166.jpeg 300w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 733px) 100vw, 733px\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp style=\"text-align: center;\"\u003E\u003Cem\u003EComparison between Machine Learning &amp; Deep Learning\u003C\u002Fem\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003ENow that we understand the importance of deep learning and why it transcends traditional machine learning algorithms, let&#8217;s get into the crux of this article. We will discuss the different types of neural networks that you will work with to solve deep learning problems.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Ch2\u003EDifferent types of Neural Networks in Deep Learning\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EThis article focuses on three important types of neural networks that form the basis for most pre-trained models in deep learning:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cul\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003EArtificial Neural Networks (ANN)\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003EConvolution Neural Networks (CNN)\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003ERecurrent Neural Networks (RNN)\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003ELet&#8217;s discuss each neural network in detail.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Ch2\u003EArtificial Neural Network (ANN) &#8211; What is a ANN and why should you use it?\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EA single perceptron (or neuron) can be imagined as a Logistic Regression. Artificial Neural Network, or ANN, is a group of multiple perceptrons\u002F neurons at each layer. ANN is also known as a \u003Cstrong\u003EFeed-Forward Neural network\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E because inputs are processed only in the forward direction:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Ca rel=\"lightbox\" href=https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002FANN-Graph.gif\u003E\u003Cimg class=\"aligncenter wp-image-61692 size-medium\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002FANN-Graph-300x169.gif\" alt=\"Neural Networks\" width=\"300\" height=\"169\" srcset=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002FANN-Graph-300x169.gif 300w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002FANN-Graph-768x432.gif 768w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002FANN-Graph-850x478.gif 850w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002FANN-Graph-257x144.gif 257w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp style=\"text-align: center;\"\u003E\u003Cem\u003EANN\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Fem\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EAs you can see here, ANN consists of 3 layers &#8211; Input, Hidden and Output. The input layer accepts the inputs, the hidden layer processes the inputs, and the output layer produces the result. Essentially, each layer tries to learn certain weights.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cem\u003EIf you want to explore more about how ANN works, I recommend going through the below article:\u003C\u002Fem\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cul\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003E\u003Cem\u003E\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fblog\u002F2017\u002F05\u002Fneural-network-from-scratch-in-python-and-r\u002F?utm_source=blog&amp;utm_medium=cnn-vs-rnn-vs-mlp-analyzing-3-types-of-neural-networks-in-deep-learning\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003E\u003Cspan class=\"breadcrumb_last\"\u003EUnderstanding and Coding Neural Networks From Scratch in Python and R\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fem\u003E\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EANN can be used to solve problems related to:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cul\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003ETabular data\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003EImage data\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003EText data\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Ch3\u003EAdvantages of Artificial Neural Network (ANN)\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EArtificial Neural Network is capable of learning any nonlinear function. Hence, these networks are popularly known as \u003Cstrong\u003EUniversal Function Approximators\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E. ANNs have the capacity to learn weights that map any input to the output.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EOne of the main reasons behind universal approximation is the \u003Cstrong\u003Eactivation function\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E. Activation functions introduce nonlinear properties to the network. This helps the network learn any complex relationship between input and output.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Ca rel=\"lightbox\" href=https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002F13UpdymQx-C1tBKRnfD7eOg.gif\u003E\u003Cimg class=\"aligncenter wp-image-61694 size-full\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002F13UpdymQx-C1tBKRnfD7eOg.gif\" alt=\"Feed forward Neural Network\" width=\"640\" height=\"395\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp style=\"text-align: center;\"\u003E\u003Cem\u003EPerceptron\u003C\u002Fem\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EAs you can see here, the output at each neuron is the activation of a weighted sum of inputs. But wait &#8211;  what happens if there is no activation function? The network only learns the linear function and can never learn complex relationships. That&#8217;s why:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cblockquote\u003E\r\n\u003Cp style=\"text-align: center;\"\u003EAn activation function is a powerhouse of ANN!\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Fblockquote\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Ch3\u003EChallenges with Artificial Neural Network (ANN)\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\r\n\u003Cul\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003EWhile solving an image classification problem using ANN, the first step is to convert a 2-dimensional image into a 1-dimensional vector prior to training the model. This has two drawbacks:\r\n\u003Cul\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003EThe number of trainable parameters increases drastically with an increase in the size of the image\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Ca rel=\"lightbox\" href=https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002F136MELEhgZsPFuzlZvObnxA.gif\u003E\u003Cimg class=\"aligncenter wp-image-61696 size-medium\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002F136MELEhgZsPFuzlZvObnxA-300x180.gif\" alt=\"MLP image classification\" width=\"300\" height=\"180\" srcset=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002F136MELEhgZsPFuzlZvObnxA-300x180.gif 300w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002F136MELEhgZsPFuzlZvObnxA-768x461.gif 768w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002F136MELEhgZsPFuzlZvObnxA-850x510.gif 850w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp style=\"text-align: center;\"\u003E\u003Cem\u003EANN: Image classification\u003C\u002Fem\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E                   In the above scenario, if the size of the image is 224*224, then the number of trainable parameters at the first hidden layer with just 4 neurons is 602,112. That&#8217;s huge!\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cul\u003E\r\n\u003Cli style=\"list-style-type: none;\"\u003E\r\n\u003Cul\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003E ANN loses the spatial features of an image. Spatial features refer to the arrangement of the pixels in an image. I will touch upon this in detail in the following sections\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003EOne common problem in all these neural networks is the \u003Cstrong\u003EVanishing and Exploding Gradient\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E. This problem is associated with the \u003Cstrong\u003Ebackpropagation\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E algorithm. The weights of a neural network are updated through this backpropagation algorithm by finding the gradients:\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Ca rel=\"lightbox\" href=https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002F7-Figure1-1-1.png\u003E\u003Cimg class=\"aligncenter wp-image-61845 size-medium\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002F7-Figure1-1-1-300x188.png\" alt=\"FFN\" width=\"300\" height=\"188\" srcset=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002F7-Figure1-1-1-300x188.png 300w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002F7-Figure1-1-1.png 694w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp style=\"text-align: center;\"\u003E\u003Cem\u003EBackward Propagation\u003C\u002Fem\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E           So, in the case of a very deep neural network (network with a large number of hidden layers), the gradient vanishes or explodes as it propagates backward which leads to vanishing and exploding gradient.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cul\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003EANN cannot capture sequential information in the input data which is required for dealing with sequence data\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003ENow, let us see how to overcome the limitations of MLP using two different architectures &#8211; Recurrent Neural Networks (RNN) and Convolution Neural Networks (CNN).\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Ch2\u003ERecurrent Neural Network (RNN) &#8211; What is an RNN and why should you use it?\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003ELet us first try to understand the difference between an RNN and an ANN from the architecture perspective:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cblockquote\u003E\r\n\u003Cp style=\"text-align: center;\"\u003EA looping constraint on the hidden layer of ANN turns to RNN.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Fblockquote\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Ca rel=\"lightbox\" href=https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002Fassets_-LvBP1svpACTB1R1x_U4_-LwEQnQw8wHRB6_2zYtG_-LwEZT8zd07mLDuaQZwy_image-1.png\u003E\u003Cimg class=\"aligncenter wp-image-61700 size-full\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002Fassets_-LvBP1svpACTB1R1x_U4_-LwEQnQw8wHRB6_2zYtG_-LwEZT8zd07mLDuaQZwy_image-1.png\" alt=\"RNN\" width=\"497\" height=\"265\" srcset=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002Fassets_-LvBP1svpACTB1R1x_U4_-LwEQnQw8wHRB6_2zYtG_-LwEZT8zd07mLDuaQZwy_image-1.png 497w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002Fassets_-LvBP1svpACTB1R1x_U4_-LwEQnQw8wHRB6_2zYtG_-LwEZT8zd07mLDuaQZwy_image-1-300x160.png 300w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002Fassets_-LvBP1svpACTB1R1x_U4_-LwEQnQw8wHRB6_2zYtG_-LwEZT8zd07mLDuaQZwy_image-1-262x141.png 262w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 497px) 100vw, 497px\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EAs you can see here, RNN has a recurrent connection on the hidden state. This looping constraint ensures that sequential information is captured in the input data.\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cem\u003EYou should go through the below tutorial to learn more about how RNNs work under the hood (and how to build one in Python):\u003C\u002Fem\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cul\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003E\u003Cem\u003E\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fblog\u002F2017\u002F12\u002Fintroduction-to-recurrent-neural-networks\u002F?utm_source=blog&amp;utm_medium=cnn-vs-rnn-vs-mlp-analyzing-3-types-of-neural-networks-in-deep-learning\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003E\u003Cspan class=\"breadcrumb_last\"\u003EFundamentals of Deep Learning – Introduction to Recurrent Neural Networks\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fem\u003E\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EWe can use recurrent neural networks to solve the problems related to:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cul\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003ETime Series data\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003EText data\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003EAudio data\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Ch3\u003EAdvantages of Recurrent Neural Network (RNN)\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\r\n\u003Cul\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003ERNN captures the sequential information present in the input data i.e. dependency between the words in the text while making predictions:\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Ca rel=\"lightbox\" href=https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002F1d_POV7c8fzHbKuTgJzCxtA.gif\u003E\u003Cimg class=\"aligncenter wp-image-61701 size-full\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002F1d_POV7c8fzHbKuTgJzCxtA.gif\" alt=\"seq2seq\" width=\"500\" height=\"270\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp style=\"text-align: center;\"\u003E\u003Cem\u003EMany2Many Seq2Seq model\u003C\u002Fem\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E           As you can see here, the output (o1, o2, o3, o4)  at each time step depends not only on the current word but also on the previous words.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cul\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003ERNNs share the parameters across different time steps. This is popularly known as \u003Cstrong\u003EParameter Sharing\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E. This results in fewer parameters to train and decreases the computational cost\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cimg class=\"wp-image-61754 aligncenter\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002FThe-standard-RNN-and-unfolded-RNN-300x131.png\" alt=\"RNN\" width=\"362\" height=\"158\" srcset=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002FThe-standard-RNN-and-unfolded-RNN-300x131.png 300w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002FThe-standard-RNN-and-unfolded-RNN-768x335.png 768w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002FThe-standard-RNN-and-unfolded-RNN.png 850w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 362px) 100vw, 362px\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp style=\"text-align: center;\"\u003E\u003Cem\u003EUnrolled RNN\u003C\u002Fem\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E            As shown in the above figure, 3 weight matrices &#8211; U, W, V, are the weight matrices that are shared across all the time steps.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Ch3\u003EChallenges with Recurrent Neural Networks (RNN)\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EDeep RNNs (RNNs with a large number of time steps) also suffer from the vanishing and exploding gradient problem which is a common problem in all the different types of neural networks.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cimg class=\"wp-image-61839 aligncenter\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002F1a5EbLhyxbPR78PhiV5Esjg-300x103.png\" alt=\"vanishing gradient\" width=\"405\" height=\"139\" srcset=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002F1a5EbLhyxbPR78PhiV5Esjg-300x103.png 300w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002F1a5EbLhyxbPR78PhiV5Esjg-768x264.png 768w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002F1a5EbLhyxbPR78PhiV5Esjg-1536x529.png 1536w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002F1a5EbLhyxbPR78PhiV5Esjg-850x293.png 850w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002F1a5EbLhyxbPR78PhiV5Esjg.png 1600w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 405px) 100vw, 405px\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp style=\"text-align: center;\"\u003E\u003Cem\u003EVanishing Gradient (RNN)\u003C\u002Fem\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EAs you can see here, the gradient computed at the last time step vanishes as it reaches the initial time step.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Ch2\u003EConvolution Neural Network (CNN) &#8211; What is a CNN and Why Should you use it?\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EConvolutional neural networks (CNN) are all the rage in the deep learning community right now. These \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcourses.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fcourses\u002Fconvolutional-neural-networks-cnn-from-scratch?utm_source=blog&amp;utm_medium=cnn-vs-rnn-vs-mlp-analyzing-3-types-of-neural-networks-in-deep-learning\"\u003ECNN\u003C\u002Fa\u003E models are being used across different applications and domains, and they&#8217;re especially prevalent in image and video processing projects.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EThe building blocks of CNNs are filters a.k.a. kernels.\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E Kernels are used to extract the relevant features from the input using the convolution operation. Let&#8217;s try to grasp the importance of filters using images as input data. Convolving an image with filters results in a feature map:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cimg class=\"size-full wp-image-61705 aligncenter\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002FUntitled-Diagram.png\" alt=\"\" width=\"580\" height=\"168\" srcset=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002FUntitled-Diagram.png 580w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002FUntitled-Diagram-300x87.png 300w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 580px) 100vw, 580px\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp style=\"text-align: center;\"\u003E\u003Cem\u003EOutput of Convolution\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Fem\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cem\u003EWant to explore more about Convolution Neural Networks? I recommend going through the below tutorial:\u003C\u002Fem\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cul\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003E\u003Cem\u003E\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fblog\u002F2020\u002F02\u002Fmathematics-behind-convolutional-neural-network\u002F?utm_source=blog&amp;utm_medium=cnn-vs-rnn-vs-mlp-analyzing-3-types-of-neural-networks-in-deep-learning\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003EDemystifying the Mathematics Behind Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs)\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fem\u003E\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EYou can also enrol in this free course on CNN to learn more about them: \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcourses.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fcourses\u002Fconvolutional-neural-networks-cnn-from-scratch?utm_source=blog&amp;utm_medium=cnn-vs-rnn-vs-mlp-analyzing-3-types-of-neural-networks-in-deep-learning\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003EConvolutional Neural Networks from Scratch\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EThough convolutional neural networks were introduced to solve problems related to image data, they perform impressively on sequential inputs as well.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Ch3\u003EAdvantages of Convolution Neural Network (CNN)\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\r\n\u003Cul\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003ECNN learns the filters automatically without mentioning it explicitly. These filters help in extracting the right and relevant features from the input data\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Ca rel=\"lightbox\" href=https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002F1oB3S5yHHhvougJkPXuc8og.gif\u003E\u003Cimg class=\"wp-image-61707 size-full aligncenter\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002F1oB3S5yHHhvougJkPXuc8og.gif\" alt=\"CNN - Image Classification\" width=\"600\" height=\"337\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp style=\"text-align: center;\"\u003E\u003Cem\u003ECNN &#8211; Image Classification\u003C\u002Fem\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cul\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003E\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcourses.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fcourses\u002Fconvolutional-neural-networks-cnn-from-scratch?utm_source=blog&amp;utm_medium=cnn-vs-rnn-vs-mlp-analyzing-3-types-of-neural-networks-in-deep-learning\"\u003ECNN\u003C\u002Fa\u003E captures the \u003Cstrong\u003Espatial features\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E from an image. Spatial features refer to the arrangement of pixels and the relationship between them in an image. They help us in identifying the object accurately, the location of an object, as well as its relation with other objects in an image\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cimg class=\"aligncenter size-full wp-image-61760\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002F108439.1.jpg\" alt=\"dravid\" width=\"160\" height=\"224\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EIn the above image, we can easily identify that its a human&#8217;s face by looking at specific features like eyes, nose, mouth and so on. We can also see how these specific features are arranged in an image. That&#8217;s exactly what \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcourses.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fcourses\u002Fconvolutional-neural-networks-cnn-from-scratch?utm_source=blog&amp;utm_medium=cnn-vs-rnn-vs-mlp-analyzing-3-types-of-neural-networks-in-deep-learning\"\u003ECNNs\u003C\u002Fa\u003E are capable of capturing.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cul\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003ECNN also follows the concept of parameter sharing. A single filter is applied across different parts of an input to produce a feature map:\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Ca rel=\"lightbox\" href=https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002F1BMngs93_rm2_BpJFH2mS0Q.gif\u003E\u003Cimg class=\"aligncenter wp-image-61765 size-full\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002F1BMngs93_rm2_BpJFH2mS0Q.gif\" alt=\"cnn\" width=\"294\" height=\"288\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp style=\"text-align: center;\"\u003E\u003Cem\u003EConvolving image with a filter\u003C\u002Fem\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003ENotice that the 2*2 feature map is produced by sliding the same 3*3 filter across different parts of an image.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Ch3\u003EComparing the Different Types of Neural Networks (MLP(ANN)  vs. RNN vs. CNN)\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EHere, I have summarized some of the differences among different types of neural networks:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cimg class=\"aligncenter size-full wp-image-62388\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002Ftable.png\" alt=\"mlp vs cnn vs rnn\" width=\"1050\" height=\"520\" srcset=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002Ftable.png 1050w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002Ftable-300x149.png 300w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002Ftable-768x380.png 768w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002Ftable-850x421.png 850w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1050px) 100vw, 1050px\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Ch2\u003EEnd Notes\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EIn this article, I have discussed the importance of deep learning and the differences among different types of neural networks. I strongly believe that knowledge sharing is the ultimate form of learning. I am looking forward to hearing a few more differences!\u003C\u002Fp\u003E","image_url":{"full":"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2019\u002F05\u002Fman-nueral-network-red-.jpg","large":"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2019\u002F05\u002Fman-nueral-network-red--850x421.jpg","medium":"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2019\u002F05\u002Fman-nueral-network-red--360x206.jpg","small":"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2019\u002F05\u002Fman-nueral-network-red--262x141.jpg","nano":"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2019\u002F05\u002Fman-nueral-network-red--100x72.jpg"},"categories":[{"id":"9eae58ce-9f50-4a51-85ac-8516598eb40f","title":"Listicle","slug":"listicle","description":"","permalink":""},{"id":"ee6ebb13-2def-4727-a21c-a1dea71c4c85","title":"Intermediate","slug":"intermediate","description":"","permalink":""},{"id":"6b69519f-e2e7-4d7e-bb1b-22c4c978a5d0","title":"Algorithm","slug":"algorithm","description":"","permalink":""},{"id":"35796ebb-ee58-49a1-bdb5-c157a85668a6","title":"Deep Learning","slug":"deep-learning","description":"","permalink":""}],"author":{"id":"7694b9ef-e0a8-473f-9f08-e33844a907bf","full_name":"Aravind Pai","bio":"Aravind is passionate about building data-driven products for the sports domain.
