He strongly believes that analytics in sports can be a game-changer."}}}},"is_bookmarked":false,"extra_info":{}},{"id":"8eb45da6-3042-4d6a-90b3-ed60ba7c414e","created":"2020-02-03T04:00:34.638285Z","modified":"2021-05-01T13:54:47.987393Z","resource_id":"61257","resource_type":"article","resource_permalink":"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fblog\u002F2020\u002F02\u002F5-open-source-machine-learning-projects-data-scientist\u002F","resource_created":"2020-02-03T02:38:31Z","resource_modified":"2020-02-03T02:38:31Z","start":null,"end":null,"is_featured":true,"is_priced":false,"price_currency":"INR","price":null,"title":"5 Open Source Machine Learning Projects to Challenge your Inner Data Scientist","sub_title":"","description":"Overview Start 2020 on the right note with these 5 challenging open-source machine learning projects These machine learning projects cover a diverse range of …","source_description":"\u003Ch2\u003EOverview\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\r\n\u003Cul\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003EStart 2020 on the right note with these 5 challenging open-source machine learning projects\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003EThese machine learning projects cover a diverse range of domains, including Python programming and NLP\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Ch2\u003EIntroduction\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EMore people than ever before are looking for a way to transition into data science. Whether you&#8217;re a fresh college graduate, a relatively new entrant in the industry, a mid-level professional, or someone who&#8217;s just curious about \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcourses.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fcourses\u002Fapplied-machine-learning-beginner-to-professional?utm_source=blog&amp;utm_medium=5-open-source-machine-learning-projects-data-scientist\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003Emachine learning\u003C\u002Fa\u003E &#8211; everyone wants a piece of the data science pie.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EAnd if you&#8217;re from India, you would surely have read about the Government&#8217;s investment in the data field (in the 2020 Union Budget). This is a great time to invest in your career!\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EAnd one of the best ways to get your data science career off the ground is to invest in yourself. Here&#8217;s a simple path to do that:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cul\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003EFind an open-source machine learning project that you are passionate about\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003EUnderstand the current benchmark solution for that project\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003EIf it exists, learn from it. If it doesn&#8217;t, carve out a solution using your existing machine learning skillset\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Ca rel=\"lightbox\" href=https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2019\u002F12\u002Fopen_source_projects_data_science.png\u003E\u003Cimg class=\"aligncenter size-full wp-image-59471\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2019\u002F12\u002Fopen_source_projects_data_science.png\" alt=\"open_source_machine_learning\" width=\"1050\" height=\"520\" srcset=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2019\u002F12\u002Fopen_source_projects_data_science.png 1050w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2019\u002F12\u002Fopen_source_projects_data_science-300x149.png 300w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2019\u002F12\u002Fopen_source_projects_data_science-768x380.png 768w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2019\u002F12\u002Fopen_source_projects_data_science-850x421.png 850w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1050px) 100vw, 1050px\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EI&#8217;ve picked out 5 open-source machine learning projects (created in January 2020) to acquaint you with the latest state-of-the-art frameworks and libraries. As always, I tried to diversify the list as much as possible. You&#8217;ll see a bit of everything sprinkled in, from \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcourses.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fcourses\u002Fnatural-language-processing-nlp?utm_source=blog&amp;utm_medium=5-open-source-machine-learning-projects-data-scientist\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003ENatural Language Processing (NLP)\u003C\u002Fa\u003E to \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcourses.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fcourses\u002Fintroduction-to-data-science?utm_source=blog&amp;utm_medium=5-open-source-machine-learning-projects-data-scientist\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003EPython programming\u003C\u002Fa\u003E ideas.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cem\u003EHead \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fblog\u002Fcategory\u002Fgithub\u002F?utm_source=blog&amp;utm_medium=5-open-source-machine-learning-projects-data-scientist\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003Eover here\u003C\u002Fa\u003E if you&#8217;re interested in checking out the previous projects we&#8217;ve showcased in this monthly series. This is the 3rd year of this series &#8211; thanks to our community for the overwhelming response!\u003C\u002Fem\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Ch2 class=\"cye-lm-tag\"\u003EWithout further ado, here are the 5 open-source machine learning projects\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Ca rel=\"lightbox\" href=https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2018\u002F02\u002Fgithub.png\u003E\u003Cimg class=\"aligncenter size-full wp-image-41600\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2018\u002F02\u002Fgithub.png\" alt=\"\" width=\"310\" height=\"163\" srcset=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2018\u002F02\u002Fgithub.png 310w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2018\u002F02\u002Fgithub-300x158.png 300w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 310px) 100vw, 310px\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Ch2\u003E\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fgithub.com\u002Flucidrains\u002Freformer-pytorch\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003EReformer &#8211; The Efficient Transformer in PyTorch\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EThe Transformer architecture changed the \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcourses.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fcourses\u002Fnatural-language-processing-nlp?utm_source=blog&amp;utm_medium=5-open-source-machine-learning-projects-data-scientist\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003ENatural Language Processing (NLP)\u003C\u002Fa\u003E landscape. It has spawned a plethora of \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fblog\u002F2019\u002F08\u002Fcomplete-list-important-frameworks-nlp\u002F?utm_source=blog&amp;utm_medium=5-open-source-machine-learning-projects-data-scientist\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003ENLP frameworks\u003C\u002Fa\u003E, such as \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fblog\u002F2019\u002F09\u002Fdemystifying-bert-groundbreaking-nlp-framework\u002F?utm_source=blog&amp;utm_medium=5-open-source-machine-learning-projects-data-scientist\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003EBERT\u003C\u002Fa\u003E, XLNet, \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fblog\u002F2019\u002F07\u002Fopenai-gpt2-text-generator-python\u002F?utm_source=blog&amp;utm_medium=5-open-source-machine-learning-projects-data-scientist\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003EGPT-2\u003C\u002Fa\u003E, among others.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EBut there&#8217;s an issue I&#8217;m sure most of you will relate to &#8211; these Transformer-powered models are LARGE. They achieve state-of-the-art results but they&#8217;re way too expensive and beyond the scope of most folks who want to learn and implement them.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cblockquote\u003E\u003Cp\u003EThis is where the Reformer model comes in. Reformer performs as well as these Transformer models, but it does so while using far less resources and money.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003C\u002Fblockquote\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Ca rel=\"lightbox\" href=https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002Freformer_open_source_machine_learning_project.png\u003E\u003Cimg class=\"aligncenter size-full wp-image-61261\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002Freformer_open_source_machine_learning_project.png\" alt=\"reformer_open_source_machine_learning_project\" width=\"1062\" height=\"422\" srcset=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002Freformer_open_source_machine_learning_project.png 1062w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002Freformer_open_source_machine_learning_project-300x119.png 300w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002Freformer_open_source_machine_learning_project-768x305.png 768w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002Freformer_open_source_machine_learning_project-850x338.png 850w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1062px) 100vw, 1062px\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EThis GitHub repository I&#8217;ve linked above contains the PyTorch implementation of Reformer. The author of the project has provided a simple but effective example along with the entire code to help you build your own model.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EI encourage you to read about the inner workings of Reformer in the official research paper \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fopenreview.net\u002Fpdf?id=rkgNKkHtvB\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003Ehere\u003C\u002Fa\u003E.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EYou can install Reformer on your machine using the below command:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cpre\u003Epip install reformer_pytorch\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EThe below articles are essential reading if you&#8217;re new to the Transformer architecture and the PyTorch framework:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cul\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003E\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fblog\u002F2019\u002F06\u002Funderstanding-transformers-nlp-state-of-the-art-models\u002F?utm_source=blog&amp;utm_medium=5-open-source-machine-learning-projects-data-scientist\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003EHow do Transformers Work in NLP? A Guide to the Latest State-of-the-Art Models\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003E\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fblog\u002F2019\u002F09\u002Fintroduction-to-pytorch-from-scratch\u002F?utm_source=blog&amp;utm_medium=5-open-source-machine-learning-projects-data-scientist\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003EA Beginner-Friendly Guide to PyTorch and How it Works from Scratch\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Ch2\u003E\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fgithub.com\u002Ffirmai\u002Fpandapy\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003EPandaPy &#8211; Your New Favorite Python Library\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EI came across PandaPy last week and have already used it in my current project. It is a fascinating Python library with a lot of potential to become mainstream.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EIf you are working on a machine learning project with mixed data types (int, float, datetime, str, etc.), you should try out PandaPy instead of Pandas. It consumes roughly one-third less memory than Pandas for these data types!\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cblockquote\u003E\u003Cp\u003E&#8220;If you have smaller Pandas dataframes (&lt;50K number of records) in a production environment, then it is worth considering PandaPy.&#8221;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003C\u002Fblockquote\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Ca rel=\"lightbox\" href=https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002Fpandapy_open_source_machine_learning_projects.jpg\u003E\u003Cimg class=\"aligncenter size-full wp-image-61262\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002Fpandapy_open_source_machine_learning_projects.jpg\" alt=\"pandapy_open_source_machine_learning_projects\" width=\"960\" height=\"480\" srcset=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002Fpandapy_open_source_machine_learning_projects.jpg 960w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002Fpandapy_open_source_machine_learning_projects-300x150.jpg 300w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002Fpandapy_open_source_machine_learning_projects-768x384.jpg 768w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002Fpandapy_open_source_machine_learning_projects-850x425.jpg 850w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 960px) 100vw, 960px\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EHere are three key areas you&#8217;ll find interesting (I&#8217;ve taken these points verbatim from the PandaPy GitHub repository):\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Col class=\"cye-lm-tag\"\u003E\r\n\u003Cli class=\"cye-lm-tag\"\u003EFor simple calculations on a small dataset (i.e, plus, mult, log) PandaPy is 25x &#8211; 80x faster than Pandas\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003EFor table functions (i.e., group, pivot, drop, concat, fillna) on a small data set PandaPy is 5x &#8211; 100x times faster than Pandas\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003EFor most use cases with small data, PandaPy is faster than Dask, Modin Ray and Pandas\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Fol\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EInstall PandaPy using pip:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cpre\u003E!pip3 install pandapy\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EIf you still want to stick with Pandas, then check out the latest major release (v1.0.0) \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fblog\u002F2020\u002F01\u002Fpandas-version-1-top-4-features\u002F?utm_source=blog&amp;utm_medium=5-open-source-machine-learning-projects-data-scientist\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003Ehere\u003C\u002Fa\u003E.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Ch2\u003E\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fgithub.com\u002Fgiswqs\u002Fearthengine-py-notebooks\"\u003EGoogle Earth Engine &#8211; 300+ Jupyter Notebooks to Analyze Geospatial Data\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EWhat a brilliant GitHub repository! I&#8217;ve had a lot of aspiring data scientists reach out to me on LinkedIn asking about how to get started with geospatial analysis. It&#8217;s a very interesting field with petabytes of data available. We just need a structured approach to clean and analyze it.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cblockquote\u003E\u003Cp\u003EThis amazing repository is a collection of 300+ Jupyter notebooks that contain examples of using \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fearthengine.google.com\u002F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003EGoogle Earth Engine\u003C\u002Fa\u003E data.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003C\u002Fblockquote\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EHere&#8217;s a really cool GIF that demonstrates one of the visualizations you will generate using these notebooks:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Ca rel=\"lightbox\" href=https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002Fgoogle_earth_engine_open_source_machine_learning_projects.gif\u003E\u003Cimg class=\"aligncenter size-full wp-image-61263\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002Fgoogle_earth_engine_open_source_machine_learning_projects.gif\" alt=\"\" width=\"1033\" height=\"672\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EThese notebooks rely on three Python libraries to execute the code:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cul\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003EEarth Engine Python API\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003EFolium\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003EGeehydro\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EThe GitHub repository contains plenty of examples with Python code to get you started. Dig in and have fun!\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EHere&#8217;s an excellent article to get started with Geospatial Data:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cul\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003E\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fmedium.com\u002Fanalytics-vidhya\u002Fgeospatial-data-and-its-role-in-data-science-c60b2e0d3f7f\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003EGeospatial Data and its Role in Data Science\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Ch2\u003E\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fgithub.com\u002Fantvis\u002FAVA\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003EAVA &#8211; Automated Visual Analytics\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EHere&#8217;s another quality data visualization idea for you. The thought of automating the data exploration step has been floated around for a while without any substantial frameworks. Until now\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cblockquote\u003E\u003Cp\u003EAVA, short for Automated Visual Analytics, is a framework by Alibaba that aims to make visual analytics AI-driven and automated.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003C\u002Fblockquote\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EHere&#8217;s a demo showing the power of AVA:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Ca rel=\"lightbox\" href=https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002FAVA_open_source_machine_learning_projects.gif\u003E\u003Cimg class=\"aligncenter size-full wp-image-61264\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F02\u002FAVA_open_source_machine_learning_projects.gif\" alt=\"AVA_open_source_machine_learning_projects\" width=\"1080\" height=\"600\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EI highly recommend checking out the below resources to enhance and build your data visualization profile:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cul\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003E\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcourses.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fcourses\u002Ftableau-2-0?utm_source=blog&amp;utm_medium=5-open-source-machine-learning-projects-data-scientist\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003EMastering Tableau from Scratch: Become a Data Visualization Rockstar\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003E\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fblog\u002Ftag\u002Fdata-visualization\u002F?utm_source=blog&amp;utm_medium=5-open-source-machine-learning-projects-data-scientist\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003ECollection of Data Visualization Articles and Tutorials\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Ch2\u003E\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fdanywind.github.io\u002F2020\u002F01\u002F28\u002Ffast-neptune.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003EFast Neptune &#8211; Speed up your Machine Learning Projects\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EReproducibility is a crucial aspect of any machine learning project these days, whether that&#8217;s in research or the industry. We need to track every test we perform, every iteration, and every parameter of our machine learning model, along with the results.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cblockquote\u003E\u003Cp\u003EThe Fast Neptune library enables us to quickly record all the information we need to launch our machine learning experiments. In other words, Fast Neptune is your answer to the reproducibility question you might have asked while reading the above paragraph.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003C\u002Fblockquote\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EHere are the features Fast Neptune uses to help us run quick experiments (quoting from the above link):\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cul class=\"cye-lm-tag\"\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003EMetadata about the machine where the code is run, including OS, and OS version\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003ERequirements of the notebook where the experiments are run\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003EParameters used during the experience, which means the names of the values of the variables you want to track\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003ECode you used during the run that you want to record\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EPretty neat, right? Install Fast Neptune using just one line of code:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cpre\u003Epip install fast-neptune\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Ch3\u003ECouple of noteworthy frameworks to keep an eye on:\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EI wanted to highlight a couple of other major releases in January 2020 that you should be aware of:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Col\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fthinc.ai\u002F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003EThinc\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E: This is a lightweight deep learning library from the makers of \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fblog\u002F2019\u002F09\u002Fintroduction-information-extraction-python-spacy\u002F?utm_source=blog&amp;utm_medium=5-open-source-machine-learning-projects-data-scientist\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003EspaCy\u003C\u002Fa\u003E. Thinc &#8220;offers an elegant, type-checked, functional-programming API for composing models, with support for layers defined in other frameworks such as \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fblog\u002F2019\u002F09\u002Fintroduction-to-pytorch-from-scratch\u002F?utm_source=blog&amp;utm_medium=5-open-source-machine-learning-projects-data-scientist\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003EPyTorch\u003C\u002Fa\u003E, \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fblog\u002F2016\u002F10\u002Fan-introduction-to-implementing-neural-networks-using-tensorflow\u002F?utm_source=blog&amp;utm_medium=5-open-source-machine-learning-projects-data-scientist\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003ETensorFlow\u003C\u002Fa\u003E or MXNet&#8221;\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fai.googleblog.com\u002F2020\u002F01\u002Ftowards-conversational-agent-that-can.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003EGoogle&#8217;s Incredible Human-Like Generative Chatbot\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E: Google has created Meena, a 2.6 billion parameter end-to-end trained neural conversational model. Meena can conduct conversations that are more sensible and specific than existing state-of-the-art chatbots. Will they open-source the code? That remains to be seen but this is one to keep your eye on\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Fol\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Ch2\u003EEnd Notes\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E2020 is off to a fast start in the machine learning space. The state-of-the-art continues to evolve at a rapid pace and it can become overwhelming for newcomers to keep up.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EThat&#8217;s why I publish these monthly articles where I aim to bring out the most relevant and useful open-source machine learning projects for our community.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EIs there any other machine learning project or framework you want to highlight? I would love to hear your thoughts and ideas in the comments section below. Yes, I&#8217;m talking about none other than &#8211; Regular Expressions; the quintessential skill for a data scientist&#8217;s tool kit!\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003ERegular Expressions are useful for numerous practical day to day tasks that a data scientist encounters. They are used everywhere from data pre-processing to \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcourses.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fcourses\u002Fnatural-language-processing-nlp?utm_source=blog\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003Enatural language processing\u003C\u002Fa\u003E, pattern matching, \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fblog\u002F2017\u002F07\u002Fweb-scraping-in-python-using-scrapy\u002F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003Eweb scraping\u003C\u002Fa\u003E, \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fblog\u002F2019\u002F09\u002Fintroduction-information-extraction-python-spacy\u002F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003Edata extraction\u003C\u002Fa\u003E and what not!\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cimg class=\"size-full wp-image-61068 aligncenter\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F01\u002F1-2.png\" alt=\"\" width=\"1050\" height=\"520\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EThat&#8217;s why I wanted to write this article, to list some of those mundane tasks that you or your data team can automate with the help of Regular Expressions.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EIn case your basics of Regex are a bit hazy, I recommend you to read this article for a quick recap:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cul\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003E\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fblog\u002F2015\u002F06\u002Fregular-expression-python\u002F\"\u003EBeginners Tutorial for Regular Expressions in Python\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\r\n\u003Ch2\u003ETable of Contents\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\r\n\u003Col\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003EExtracting emails from a Text Document\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003ERegular Expressions for Web Scraping (Data Collection)\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003EWorking with Date-Time features\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003EUsing Regex for Text Pre-processing (NLP)\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Fol\u003E\r\n\u003Ch2\u003EExtracting emails from a Text Document\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EA lot of times, the sales and marketing teams might require finding\u002Fextracting emails and other contact information from large text documents.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003ENow, this can be a cumbersome task if you are trying to do it manually! This is exactly the kind of situations when Regex really shines. Here&#8217;s how you can code a basic email extractor:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cdiv class=\"oembed-gist\"\u003E\u003Cscript src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fgist.github.com\u002Fmohdsanadzakirizvi\u002F365d893e077279394bcc99ae6cd2a247.js\"\u003E\u003C\u002Fscript\u003E\u003Cnoscript\u003EView the code on \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fgist.github.com\u002Fmohdsanadzakirizvi\u002F365d893e077279394bcc99ae6cd2a247\"\u003EGist\u003C\u002Fa\u003E.\u003C\u002Fnoscript\u003E\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EJust replace the &#8220;text&#8221; with the text of your document and you are good to go. Here is an example output we got:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cimg class=\"size-full wp-image-61015 aligncenter\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F01\u002FScreen-Recording-2019-12-31-at-01.04.47.10-PM.gif\" alt=\"\" width=\"948\" height=\"440\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EAmazing, isn&#8217;t it? In case you want to directly read a file and process it, you can simply add the file reading code to the Regex code:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cdiv class=\"oembed-gist\"\u003E\u003Cscript src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fgist.github.com\u002Fmohdsanadzakirizvi\u002F8036a15c1e5c838f01232d1be829ce61.js\"\u003E\u003C\u002Fscript\u003E\u003Cnoscript\u003EView the code on \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fgist.github.com\u002Fmohdsanadzakirizvi\u002F8036a15c1e5c838f01232d1be829ce61\"\u003EGist\u003C\u002Fa\u003E.\u003C\u002Fnoscript\u003E\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EThe code might look scary but it is actually very simple to understand. Let me break it down for you. We use \u003Cem\u003Ere.findall()\u003C\u002Fem\u003E to extract all the strings from the document which follows the following format:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cpre\u003Eany character a-z, any digit 0-9 and symbol '_' followed by a '@' symbol and after this symbol we can again have any character, any digit and especially a dot.\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003EHere is an image that would give you a better understanding of the same\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cimg class=\"size-full wp-image-61052 aligncenter\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F01\u002Fsksks.png\" alt=\"\" width=\"574\" height=\"248\" srcset=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F01\u002Fsksks.png 574w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F01\u002Fsksks-300x130.png 300w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 574px) 100vw, 574px\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EWasn&#8217;t that really simple? That&#8217;s the thing about Regex, it lets you perform really complex tasks with simple expressions!\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Ch2\u003ERegular Expressions for Web Scraping (Data Collection)\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EData collection is a very common part of a Data Scientist&#8217;s work and given that we are living in the age of internet, it is easier than ever to find data on the web. One can simply scrape websites like Wikipedia etc. to collect\u002Fgenerate data.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EBut web scraping has its own issues &#8211; the downloaded data is usually messy and full of noise. This is where Regex can be used effectively!\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cimg class=\"size-full wp-image-61037 aligncenter\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F01\u002Fweb_scraping.png\" alt=\"\" width=\"1132\" height=\"816\" srcset=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F01\u002Fweb_scraping.png 1132w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F01\u002Fweb_scraping-300x216.png 300w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F01\u002Fweb_scraping-768x554.png 768w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F01\u002Fweb_scraping-850x613.png 850w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F01\u002Fweb_scraping-100x72.png 100w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1132px) 100vw, 1132px\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003ESuppose this is the HTML that you want to work on:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cdiv class=\"oembed-gist\"\u003E\u003Cscript src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fgist.github.com\u002Fmohdsanadzakirizvi\u002Fd0ffaaa3456fc5e97341c8e114ddec9e.js\"\u003E\u003C\u002Fscript\u003E\u003Cnoscript\u003EView the code on \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fgist.github.com\u002Fmohdsanadzakirizvi\u002Fd0ffaaa3456fc5e97341c8e114ddec9e\"\u003EGist\u003C\u002Fa\u003E.\u003C\u002Fnoscript\u003E\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\r\n\u003Cdiv\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EIt is from a wikipedia page and has links to various other wikipedia pages. The first thing that you can check is what topics\u002Fpages does it have link for?\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003ELet&#8217;s use the following regex:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cdiv\u003E\r\n\u003Cpre\u003Eimport re\r\n\r\nre.findall(r\"&gt;([\\w\\s()]*?)&lt;\u002Fa&gt;\", html)\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\r\n\u003Cdiv\u003EOnce you use the above code, you will quickly get the list of topics:\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\r\n\u003Cdiv\u003E\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\r\n\u003Cdiv\u003E\u003Cimg class=\"size-full wp-image-61045 aligncenter\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F01\u002Farti_1.png\" alt=\"\" width=\"289\" height=\"523\" srcset=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F01\u002Farti_1.png 289w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F01\u002Farti_1-166x300.png 166w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 289px) 100vw, 289px\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\r\n\u003Cdiv\u003E\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\r\n\u003Cdiv\u003ESimilarly, you can extract the links to all these pages by using the following regex:\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\r\n\u003Cdiv\u003E\r\n\u003Cdiv\u003E\r\n\u003Cpre\u003Eimport re\r\n\r\nre.findall(r\"\\\u002Fwiki\\\u002F[\\w-]*\", html)\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\r\n\u003Cdiv\u003EOnce you execute the above code, you will get the links to all these wikipedia pages.\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\r\n\u003Cdiv\u003E\u003Cimg class=\"size-full wp-image-61046 aligncenter\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F01\u002Far2.png\" alt=\"\" width=\"331\" height=\"281\" srcset=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F01\u002Far2.png 331w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F01\u002Far2-300x255.png 300w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 331px) 100vw, 331px\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\r\n\u003Cdiv\u003E\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\r\n\u003Cdiv\u003ENote that if you just combine each of the above link with \u003Cstrong\u003Ehttp:\u002F\u002Fwikipedia.com \u003C\u002Fstrong\u003Eyou&#8217;ll be able to navigate to all these wikipedia pages. For example, to go to the page about \u003Cstrong\u003EUnsupervised Learning\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E on wikipedia you can use this link:\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\r\n\u003Cdiv\u003E\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\r\n\u003Cpre\u003Ehttps:\u002F\u002Fen.wikipedia.org\u003Cstrong\u003E\u002Fwiki\u002FUnsupervised_learning\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\r\n\u003Cdiv\u003EThe first part of the URL is simply a template to which you can attach the second part that we just extracted from the HTML page.\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\r\n\u003Cdiv\u003E\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\r\n\u003Cdiv\u003EYou can learn more about extracting information of web scraped documents using Regex from this article:\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\r\n\u003Cul\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003E\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fblog\u002F2015\u002F06\u002Fregular-expression-python\u002F\"\u003EBeginners Tutorial for Regular Expressions in Python\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\r\n\u003Ch2\u003EWorking with Date-Time features\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EMost of the real world data has some kind of Date or Time column associated with it. Such columns carry useful information for the model, but since Date and Time have multiple formats available it becomes difficult to work with such data.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cimg class=\"size-full wp-image-61047 aligncenter\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F01\u002Fdate_format_custom.png\" alt=\"\" width=\"452\" height=\"332\" srcset=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F01\u002Fdate_format_custom.png 452w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F01\u002Fdate_format_custom-300x220.png 300w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F01\u002Fdate_format_custom-100x72.png 100w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 452px) 100vw, 452px\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003ECan we use regex in this case to work with these different formats? Let us find out!\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EWe will start with a simple example, suppose you have a Date-Time value like this:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cdiv\u003E\r\n\u003Cpre\u003Edate = \"2018-03-14 06:08:18\"\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003ELet&#8217;s extract the &#8220;Year&#8221; from the date. We can simply use regex to find a pattern where 4 digits occur together:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cdiv\u003E\r\n\u003Cpre\u003Eimport re\r\n\r\nre.findall(r\"\\d{4}\", date)\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\r\n\u003Cdiv\u003EThe above code will directly give you the year from the date. Similarly, you can extract the month and day information all together in one go!\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\r\n\u003Cdiv\u003E\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\r\n\u003Cdiv class=\"oembed-gist\"\u003E\u003Cscript src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fgist.github.com\u002Fmohdsanadzakirizvi\u002F035e44ff34d0f05510ed5d50fc182e29.js\"\u003E\u003C\u002Fscript\u003E\u003Cnoscript\u003EView the code on \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fgist.github.com\u002Fmohdsanadzakirizvi\u002F035e44ff34d0f05510ed5d50fc182e29\"\u003EGist\u003C\u002Fa\u003E.\u003C\u002Fnoscript\u003E\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\r\n\u003Cdiv\u003E\r\n\u003Cdiv\u003E\u003Cimg class=\"size-full wp-image-61053 aligncenter\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F01\u002Fdates.png\" alt=\"\" width=\"191\" height=\"25\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\r\n\u003Cdiv\u003EYou can do the same thing for extracting the time info like hour, minute and second. That was one example of a date format, what if you have a date like the following format?\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\r\n\u003Cpre\u003E12th September, 2019\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\r\n\u003Cdiv\u003EYou just need to update the above Regex code. In this case, instead of having all numbers in the date format, we now have some text in between. We also have couple of extra spaces which can be matched using the \u003Cstrong\u003E\\s operator \u003C\u002Fstrong\u003Eand the way to catch the digits will be the same like previous example.\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\r\n\u003Cdiv\u003E\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\r\n\u003Cdiv\u003E\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\r\n\u003Cdiv\u003E\u003Cimg class=\"size-full wp-image-61060 aligncenter\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F01\u002Ffoundation.png\" alt=\"\" width=\"897\" height=\"146\" srcset=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F01\u002Ffoundation.png 897w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F01\u002Ffoundation-300x49.png 300w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F01\u002Ffoundation-768x125.png 768w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F01\u002Ffoundation-850x138.png 850w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 897px) 100vw, 897px\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\r\n\u003Cdiv\u003E\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\r\n\u003Cdiv\u003E\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\r\n\u003Cdiv\u003EYou can similarly create Regex for a variety of Date-Time formats and once your regex is ready, you can run the code using a loop or apply function in pandas over your columns of the dataset.\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\r\n\u003Cdiv\u003E\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\r\n\u003Cdiv\u003EIf you want to learn more about working with Date-Time features in python for machine learning, you can have a quick read here:\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\r\n\u003Cul\u003E\r\n\u003Cli class=\"entry-title\"\u003E\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fblog\u002F2019\u002F12\u002F6-powerful-feature-engineering-techniques-time-series\u002F\"\u003E6 Powerful Feature Engineering Techniques For Time Series Data (using Python)\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\r\n\u003Ch2\u003EUsing Regex for Text Pre-processing (NLP)\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EWhen working with text data, especially in NLP where we build models for tasks like text classification, machine translation and text summarization, we deal with a variety of text that comes from diverse sources.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EFor instance, we can have web scraped data, or data that&#8217;s manually collected, or data that&#8217;s extracted from images using OCR techniques and so on!\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cimg class=\"size-full wp-image-61054 aligncenter\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F01\u002Ffrom-nlp-to-text-mining-66-638.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"638\" height=\"479\" srcset=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F01\u002Ffrom-nlp-to-text-mining-66-638.jpg 638w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F01\u002Ffrom-nlp-to-text-mining-66-638-300x225.jpg 300w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F01\u002Ffrom-nlp-to-text-mining-66-638-83x63.jpg 83w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 638px) 100vw, 638px\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp style=\"text-align: center;\"\u003E\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.slideshare.net\u002FYiShinChen1\u002Ffrom-nlp-to-text-mining\"\u003ESource\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EAs you can imagine, such diversity in data also implies good amount of \u003Cstrong\u003Einconsistencies.\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E Most of this will not useful for our machine learning task as it just adds unnecessary noise and can be removed from the data. This is where Regex really comes handy!\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003ELet&#8217;s take the below piece of text as an example:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cimg class=\"size-full wp-image-61055 aligncenter\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F01\u002Fdatata.png\" alt=\"\" width=\"651\" height=\"377\" srcset=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F01\u002Fdatata.png 651w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F01\u002Fdatata-300x174.png 300w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 651px) 100vw, 651px\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EAs it&#8217;s evident, the above text has a lot of inconsistencies like random phone numbers, web links, some strange unicode characters of the form &#8220;\\x86&#8230;&#8221; etc. For our text classification task, we just need clean and pure text so let&#8217;s see how to fix this.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EWe will write a function to clean this text using Regex:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cdiv class=\"oembed-gist\"\u003E\u003Cscript src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fgist.github.com\u002Fmohdsanadzakirizvi\u002F79d16de3c9c3dac3cde87bd37affbde5.js\"\u003E\u003C\u002Fscript\u003E\u003Cnoscript\u003EView the code on \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fgist.github.com\u002Fmohdsanadzakirizvi\u002F79d16de3c9c3dac3cde87bd37affbde5\"\u003EGist\u003C\u002Fa\u003E.\u003C\u002Fnoscript\u003E\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EOnce you run the given code on the above text, you will see that the output is pretty clean:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cimg class=\"size-full wp-image-61056 aligncenter\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F01\u002Ffinal_datatata.png\" alt=\"\" width=\"650\" height=\"276\" srcset=\"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F01\u002Ffinal_datatata.png 650w, https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F01\u002Ffinal_datatata-300x127.png 300w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 650px) 100vw, 650px\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003ESo what did we do here? We basically applied a bunch of operations on our input string:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cul\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003EFirstly, we removed all the irrelevant links from the text\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\r\n\u003Cpre\u003E # removing links\r\nnewString = re.sub(r'(https|http)?:\\\u002F\\\u002F(\\w|\\.|\\\u002F|\\?|\\=|\\&amp;|\\%)*\\b', '', newString)\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\r\n\u003Cul\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003EWe also removed all the digits (phone numbers)\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\r\n\u003Cpre\u003E # fetching alphabetic characters\r\nnewString = re.sub(\"[^a-zA-Z]\", \" \", newString)\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\r\n\u003Cul\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003EPost that we used another useful package of Python \u003Cstrong\u003Enltk \u003C\u002Fstrong\u003Eto remove stopwords such as &#8220;and, the, for&#8221; etc. from our text input\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\r\n\u003Cpre\u003E    # removing stop words\r\n    tokens = [w for w in newString.split() if not w in stop_words]\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\r\n\u003Cul\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003EWe made sure to ignore any word that is smaller than 3 characters because such abbreviations like &#8220;CET&#8221;, &#8220;BHM&#8221; etc. do not add much information unless they are taken into context\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\r\n\u003Cpre\u003E # removing short words\r\nlong_words=[]\r\nfor i in tokens:\r\n    if len(i)&gt;=4: \r\n        long_words.append(i)\r\n\u003Cspan class=\"pl-k\"\u003Ereturn\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E (\u003Cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003E\" \"\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E.\u003Cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003Ejoin\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E(\u003Cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003Elong_words\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E)).\u003Cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003Estrip\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E()\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003ESo that&#8217;s text pre-processing, isn&#8217;t it fascinating? You can learn all about text pre-processing from this intuitive blog:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cul\u003E\r\n\u003Cli class=\"entry-title\"\u003E\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fblog\u002F2018\u002F02\u002Fthe-different-methods-deal-text-data-predictive-python\u002F\"\u003EUltimate guide to deal with Text Data (using Python) – for Data Scientists and Engineers\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\r\n\u003Ch2\u003EEnd Note\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EIn this article we saw some simple yet useful ways of using Regular expressions. Yet, we barely scratched the surface of the capabilities of this great tool.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EI encourage you to dig deeper and understand how Regex works (as they can be quite confusing in the beginning!) rather than simply using them blindly.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EHere are some resources that you can follow to know more about them:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cul\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003E\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fregex101.com\u002F\"\u003ERegex101\u003C\u002Fa\u003E &#8211; It is a very useful website to visualize and understand how Regex works under the hood.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003E\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fdocs.python.org\u002F3\u002Fhowto\u002Fregex.html\"\u003ERegex Documentation\u003C\u002Fa\u003E for Python 3\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003E\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.rexegg.com\u002Fregex-quickstart.html\"\u003ERegex Quickstart CheatSheet\u003C\u002Fa\u003E &#8211; This is for those who want to quickly revise regex operators.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EHave you used Regex before? Do you want to add an application to this list that I missed? Answer in comments below!\u003C\u002Fp\u003E","image_url":{"full":"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F01\u002F1-1.png","large":"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F01\u002F1-1-850x421.png","medium":"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F01\u002F1-1-360x206.png","small":"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F01\u002F1-1-262x141.png","nano":"https:\u002F\u002Fcdn.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2020\u002F01\u002F1-1-100x72.png"},"categories":[{"id":"7c7d26c8-865f-4567-9bb5-171cd056339a","title":"Unstructured Data","slug":"unstructured-data","description":"","permalink":""},{"id":"4784c415-9a31-41dc-bb8d-1e91b50bebc5","title":"Text","slug":"text","description":"","permalink":""},{"id":"9eae58ce-9f50-4a51-85ac-8516598eb40f","title":"Listicle","slug":"listicle","description":"","permalink":""},{"id":"2a73ca9f-b88b-41c7-83d2-50e705e9663b","title":"Beginner","slug":"beginner","description":"","permalink":""},{"id":"2b492840-0f55-4508-8508-200ab2904583","title":"Python","slug":"python-2","description":"","permalink":""}],"author":{"id":"f683c3fe-758a-4f44-8a4c-101942e57247","full_name":"Mohd Sanad Zaki Rizvi","bio":"A computer science graduate, I have previously worked as a Research Assistant at the University of Southern California(USC-ICT) where I employed NLP and ML to make better virtual STEM mentors. Introduction Data science projects offer you …","source_description":"\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cem\u003EThis article was originally published on October 26, 2016 and updated with new projects on 30th May, 2018.\u003C\u002Fem\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Ch2\u003EIntroduction\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Fcourses.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fcourses\u002Fintroduction-to-data-science-2?utm_source=blog&amp;utm_medium=24ultimatedatascienceprojects\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"\u003EData science projects\u003C\u002Fa\u003E offer you a promising way to kick-start your career in this field. Not only do you get to \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Fcourses.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fcourses\u002Fintroduction-to-data-science-2?utm_source=blog&amp;utm_medium=24ultimatedatascienceprojects\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"\u003Elearn data science\u003C\u002Fa\u003E by applying it, you also get projects to showcase on your CV! Nowadays, recruiters evaluate a candidate&#8217;s potential by his\u002Fher work and don&#8217;t put a lot of emphasis on certifications. It wouldn&#8217;t matter if you just tell them how much you know if you have nothing to show them! That&#8217;s where most people struggle and miss out.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp style=\"text-align: justify;\"\u003EYou might have worked on several problems before, but if you can&#8217;t make it presentable &amp; easy-to-explain, how on earth would someone know what you are capable of? That&#8217;s where these projects will help you. Think of the time you&#8217;ll spend on these projects like your training sessions. The more time you spend practicing, the better you&#8217;ll become!\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp style=\"text-align: justify;\"\u003EWe&#8217;ve made sure to provide you with a taste of a variety of problems from different domains. We believe everyone must learn to smartly work with huge amounts of data, hence large datasets are included. Also, we&#8217;ve made sure all the datasets are open and free to access.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cimg class=\"aligncenter wp-image-44993\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fs3-ap-south-1.amazonaws.com\u002Fav-blog-media\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2018\u002F05\u002F17-DATA-SCIENCE-PROJECTS-copy.png\" alt=\"\" width=\"543\" height=\"362\" srcset=\"https:\u002F\u002Fs3-ap-south-1.amazonaws.com\u002Fav-blog-media\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2018\u002F05\u002F17-DATA-SCIENCE-PROJECTS-copy.png 600w, https:\u002F\u002Fs3-ap-south-1.amazonaws.com\u002Fav-blog-media\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2018\u002F05\u002F17-DATA-SCIENCE-PROJECTS-copy-300x200.png 300w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 543px) 100vw, 543px\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Ch2 style=\"text-align: justify;\"\u003EUseful Information\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\r\n\u003Cp style=\"text-align: justify;\"\u003ETo help you decide where to begin, we&#8217;ve divided this list into 3 levels, namely:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Col\u003E\r\n\u003Cli style=\"text-align: justify;\"\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Ftrainings.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fcourses\u002Fcourse-v1:AnalyticsVidhya+DS101+2018T2\u002Fabout?utm_source=blog&amp;utm_medium=24ultimatedatascienceprojects\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"\u003EBeginner Level\u003C\u002Fa\u003E: \u003C\u002Fstrong\u003EThis level comprises of data sets which are fairly easy to work with, and don&#8217;t require complex data science techniques. You can solve them using basic \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Fcourses.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fcourses\u002Fintroduction-to-data-science-2?utm_source=blog&amp;utm_medium=24ultimatedatascienceprojects\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"\u003Eregression or classification algorithms\u003C\u002Fa\u003E. Also, these data sets have enough open tutorials to get you going. In this list, we have also provided tutorials to help you get started. You can also check out AV&#8217;s &#8216;\u003Cstrong\u003E\u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Fcourses.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fcourses\u002Fintroduction-to-data-science-2?utm_source=blog&amp;utm_medium=24ultimatedatascienceprojects\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"\u003EIntroduction to Data Science\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E&#8216; course along with this!\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003Cli style=\"text-align: justify;\"\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EIntermediate Level:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E This level comprises of data sets which are more challenging in nature. It consists of mid &amp; large data sets which require some serious pattern recognition skills. Also, feature engineering will make a difference here. There is no limit on the use of ML techniques; everything under the sun can be put to use.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003Cli style=\"text-align: justify;\"\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EAdvanced Level:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E This level is best suited for people who understand advanced topics like neural networks, deep learning, recommender systems etc. High dimensional datasets are also featured here. Also, this is the time to get creative. See the creativity best data scientists bring into their work and codes.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Fol\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Ch2\u003ETable of Contents\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\r\n\u003Col\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003E\u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Fcourses.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fcourses\u002Fintroduction-to-data-science-2?utm_source=blog&amp;utm_medium=24ultimatedatascienceprojects\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"\u003EBeginner Level\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\r\n\u003Cul\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003EIris Data\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003ELoan Prediction Data\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003EBigmart Sales Data\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003EBoston Housing Data\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003ETime Series Analysis Data\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003EWine Quality Data\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003ETurkiye Student Evaluation Data\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003EHeights and Weights Data\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003EIntermediate Level\r\n\u003Cul\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003EBlack Friday Data\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003EHuman Activity Recognition Data\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003ESiam Competition Data\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003ETrip History Data\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003EMillion Song Data\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003ECensus Income Data\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003EMovie Lens Data\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003ETwitter Classification Data\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003EAdvanced Level\r\n\u003Cul\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003EIdentify your Digits\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003EUrban Sound Classification\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003EVox Celebrity Data\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003EImageNet Data\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003EChicago Crime Data\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003EAge Detection of Indian Actors Data\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003ERecommendation Engine Data\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003Cli\u003EVisualQA Data\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\r\n\u003C\u002Fol\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Ch2\u003EBeginner Level\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\r\n\u003Ch3\u003E1. Iris Data Set\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\r\n\u003Cp style=\"text-align: justify;\"\u003E\u003Cimg class=\"alignright wp-image-28567 \" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2016\u002F10\u002FIris_dataset_scatterplot.svg_-150x150.png\" alt=\"iris_dataset_scatterplot-svg\" width=\"132\" height=\"105\" \u002F\u003EThis is probably the most versatile, easy and resourceful dataset in pattern recognition literature. Nothing could be simpler than the Iris dataset to learn classification techniques. If you are totally new to data science, this is your start line. The data has only 150 rows &amp; 4 columns.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EProblem:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E Predict the class of the flower based on available attributes.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EStart:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Farchive.ics.uci.edu\u002Fml\u002Fdatasets\u002FIris\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\"\u003EGet Data\u003C\u002Fa\u003E | \u003Cstrong\u003ETutorial:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Fwww.slideshare.net\u002Fthoi_gian\u002Firis-data-analysis-with-r\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\"\u003EGet Here\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Ch3\u003E2. Loan Prediction Dataset\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\r\n\u003Cp style=\"text-align: justify;\"\u003E\u003Cimg class=\"alignright wp-image-28588 \" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2016\u002F10\u002Fss-150x150.jpg\" alt=\"ss\" width=\"136\" height=\"134\" \u002F\u003EAmong all industries, the insurance domain has one of the largest uses of analytics &amp; data science methods. This dataset provides you a taste of working on data sets from insurance companies &#8211; what challenges are faced there, what strategies are used, which variables influence the outcome, etc. This is a classification problem. The data has 615 rows and 13 columns.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EProblem:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E Predict if a loan will get approved or not.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EStart:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fdatahack.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fcontest\u002Fpractice-problem-loan-prediction-iii\u002F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\"\u003EGet Data\u003C\u002Fa\u003E | \u003Cstrong\u003ETutorial:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fblog\u002F2016\u002F01\u002Fcomplete-tutorial-learn-data-science-python-scratch-2\u002F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\"\u003EGet Here\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Ch3\u003E3. Bigmart Sales Data Set\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\r\n\u003Cp style=\"text-align: justify;\"\u003E\u003Cimg class=\"alignright wp-image-28570 \" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2016\u002F10\u002Fshopping-cart-1269174_960_720-150x150.jpg\" alt=\"shopping-cart-1269174_960_720\" width=\"113\" height=\"99\" \u002F\u003ERetail is another industry which extensively uses analytics to optimize business processes. Tasks like product placement, inventory management, customized offers, product bundling, etc. are being smartly handled using data science techniques. As the name suggests, this data comprises of transaction records of a sales store. This is a regression problem. The data has 8523 rows of 12 variables.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EProblem:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E Predict the sales of a store.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EStart:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fdatahack.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fcontest\u002Fpractice-problem-big-mart-sales-iii\u002F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\"\u003EGet Data\u003C\u002Fa\u003E | \u003Cstrong\u003ETutorial:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fblog\u002F2016\u002F02\u002Fbigmart-sales-solution-top-20\u002F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\"\u003EGet Here\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Ch3\u003E4. Boston Housing Data Set\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\r\n\u003Cp style=\"text-align: justify;\"\u003E\u003Cimg class=\"alignright wp-image-28571 \" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2016\u002F10\u002F14938-illustration-of-a-yellow-house-pv-300x169.png\" alt=\"14938-illustration-of-a-yellow-house-pv\" width=\"147\" height=\"62\" \u002F\u003EThis is another popular dataset used in pattern recognition literature. The data set comes from the real estate industry in Boston (US). This is a regression problem. The data has 506 rows and 14 columns. Thus, it&#8217;s a fairly small data set where you can attempt any technique without worrying about your laptop&#8217;s memory being overused.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EProblem:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E Predict the median value of owner occupied homes.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EStart:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.cs.toronto.edu\u002F~delve\u002Fdata\u002Fboston\u002FbostonDetail.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"\u003EGet Data\u003C\u002Fa\u003E | \u003Cstrong\u003ETutorial:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fblog\u002F2015\u002F11\u002Fstarted-machine-learning-ms-excel-xl-miner\u002F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\"\u003EGet Here\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Ch3\u003E5. Time Series Analysis Dataset\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\r\n\u003Cp style=\"text-align: justify;\"\u003E\u003Cimg class=\"wp-image-43756 alignright\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fs3-ap-south-1.amazonaws.com\u002Fav-blog-media\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2018\u002F04\u002Ftime-series.gif\" alt=\"\" width=\"154\" height=\"98\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003ETime Series is one of the most commonly used techniques in data science. It has wide ranging applications &#8211; weather forecasting, predicting sales, analyzing year on year trends, etc. This dataset is specific to time series and the challenge here is to forecast traffic on a mode of transportation. The data has ** rows and ** columns.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EProblem:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E Predict the traffic on a new mode of transport.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EStart:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fdatahack.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fcontest\u002Fpractice-problem-time-series-2\u002F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"\u003EGet Data\u003C\u002Fa\u003E  | \u003Cstrong\u003ETutorial:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Ftrainings.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fcourses\u002Fcourse-v1:AnalyticsVidhya+TS_101+TS_term1\u002Fabout\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"\u003EGet Here\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Ch3\u003E6. Wine Quality Dataset\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\r\n\u003Cp style=\"text-align: justify;\"\u003E\u003Cimg class=\"wp-image-43749 alignright\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fs3-ap-south-1.amazonaws.com\u002Fav-blog-media\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2018\u002F04\u002FWINE.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"147\" height=\"110\" srcset=\"https:\u002F\u002Fs3-ap-south-1.amazonaws.com\u002Fav-blog-media\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2018\u002F04\u002FWINE.jpg 540w, https:\u002F\u002Fs3-ap-south-1.amazonaws.com\u002Fav-blog-media\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2018\u002F04\u002FWINE-300x225.jpg 300w, https:\u002F\u002Fs3-ap-south-1.amazonaws.com\u002Fav-blog-media\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2018\u002F04\u002FWINE-83x63.jpg 83w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 147px) 100vw, 147px\" \u002F\u003EThis is one of the most popular datasets along data science beginners. There are 4898 rows and 12 columns in this dataset.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EProblem:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E Predict the quality of the wine.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EStart:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Farchive.ics.uci.edu\u002Fml\u002Fdatasets\u002FWine+Quality\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"\u003EGet Data\u003C\u002Fa\u003E | \u003Cstrong\u003ETutorial:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fweb.stanford.edu\u002F~ilker\u002Fdoc\u002Fwine_Stats315A.pdf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"\u003EGet Here\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Ch3\u003E7. Turkiye Student Evaluation Dataset\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\r\n\u003Cp style=\"text-align: justify;\"\u003E\u003Cimg class=\"wp-image-43760 alignright\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fs3-ap-south-1.amazonaws.com\u002Fav-blog-media\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2018\u002F04\u002F140423_EDU_StudentEvaluation.jpg.CROP_.promo-mediumlarge.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"152\" height=\"109\" srcset=\"https:\u002F\u002Fs3-ap-south-1.amazonaws.com\u002Fav-blog-media\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2018\u002F04\u002F140423_EDU_StudentEvaluation.jpg.CROP_.promo-mediumlarge.jpg 590w, https:\u002F\u002Fs3-ap-south-1.amazonaws.com\u002Fav-blog-media\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2018\u002F04\u002F140423_EDU_StudentEvaluation.jpg.CROP_.promo-mediumlarge-300x214.jpg 300w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 152px) 100vw, 152px\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EThis dataset is based on an evaluation form filled out by students for different courses. It has different attributes including attendance, difficulty, score for each evaluation question, among others. This is an unsupervised learning problem. The dataset has 5820 rows and 33 columns.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EProblem: \u003C\u002Fstrong\u003EUse classification and clustering techniques to deal with the data.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EStart:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Farchive.ics.uci.edu\u002Fml\u002Fdatasets\u002FWine+Qualityhttps:\u002F\u002Farchive.ics.uci.edu\u002Fml\u002Fdatasets\u002FTurkiye+Student+Evaluation\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"\u003EGet Data\u003C\u002Fa\u003E | \u003Cstrong\u003ETutorial:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fsanghosuh.github.io\u002Fresearch\u002FLA_EdMining_SanghoSuh.pdf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"\u003EGet Here\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Ch3\u003E8. Heights and Weights Dataset\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\r\n\u003Cp style=\"text-align: justify;\"\u003E\u003Cimg class=\"wp-image-43763 alignright\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fs3-ap-south-1.amazonaws.com\u002Fav-blog-media\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2018\u002F04\u002F46612356_thumbnail-300x257.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"144\" height=\"123\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EThis is a fairly straightforward problem and is ideal for people starting off with data science. It is a regression problem.  The dataset has 25,000 rows and 3 columns (index, height and weight).\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EProblem:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E Predict the height or weight of a person.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EStart:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Fwiki.stat.ucla.edu\u002Fsocr\u002Findex.php\u002FSOCR_Data_Dinov_020108_HeightsWeights\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"\u003EGet Data\u003C\u002Fa\u003E | \u003Cstrong\u003ETutorial:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww3.nd.edu\u002F~steve\u002Fcomputing_with_data\u002F2_Motivation\u002Fmotivate_ht_wt.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"\u003EGet Here\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003EIf you&#8217;re new to the world of data science, Analytics Vidhya has curated a comprehensive course &#8211; &#8216;Introduction to Data Science&#8217;, aimed for beginners! We will cover the basics of Python, before moving to Statistics and finally going through various Modelling techniques.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\r\n\u003Ch2\u003EIntermediate Level\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\r\n\u003Ch3\u003E1. Black Friday Dataset\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\r\n\u003Cp style=\"text-align: justify;\"\u003E\u003Cimg class=\"wp-image-28573 alignright\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2016\u002F10\u002FBlack-Friday.jpg\" alt=\"black-friday\" width=\"146\" height=\"87\" \u002F\u003EThis dataset comprises of sales transactions captured at a retail store.
