alt=\"preprocessed data | face key-point recognition\" width=\"474\" height=\"243\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Ffigure\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EAlright, The data has been preprocessed. Now it&#8217;s time to create a training model. To create our CNN model, we&#8217;ll utilize the Keras framework.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003Efrom keras.models import \u003Ca name=\"kln-71\"\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003ESequential, Model\r\nfrom keras.layers import \u003Ca name=\"kln-72\"\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003EActivation, Convolution2D,MaxPooling2D,BatchNormalization, Flatten, Dense, Dropout\r\nfrom keras.layers.advanced_activations import \u003Ca name=\"kln-73\"\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003ELeakyReLU\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EStart with simply one or two epochs initially to rapidly assess how your model is training and determine whether you should alter its structure or hyperparameters. Keep track of how your model&#8217;s loss changes over time as you train: does it reduce fast at first, then slow down?\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EUse these initial observations to make changes to your model and decide on the best architecture before you train for many epochs and create a final model.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003Emodel = Sequential()\r\nmodel.add(Convolution2D(32,(3,3),padding='same',use_bias=False, input_shape=(96,96,1)))\r\nmodel.add(LeakyReLU(alpha = 0.1))\r\nmodel.add(BatchNormalization())\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003Emodel.add(Convolution2D(32,(3,3),padding='same',use_bias = False))\r\nmodel.add(LeakyReLU(alpha=0.1))\r\nmodel.add(BatchNormalization())\r\nmodel.add(MaxPooling2D(pool_size=(2,2)))\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003Emodel.add(Convolution2D(64,(3,3),padding='same',use_bias = False))\r\nmodel.add(LeakyReLU(alpha=0.1))\r\nmodel.add(BatchNormalization())\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003Emodel.add(Convolution2D(64, (3,3), padding='same', use_bias=False))\r\nmodel.add(LeakyReLU(alpha = 0.1))\r\nmodel.add(BatchNormalization())\r\nmodel.add(MaxPooling2D(pool_size=(2, 2)))\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003Emodel.add(Convolution2D(96, (3,3), padding='same', use_bias=False))\r\nmodel.add(LeakyReLU(alpha = 0.1))\r\nmodel.add(BatchNormalization())\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003Emodel.add(Convolution2D(96, (3,3), padding='same', use_bias=False))\r\nmodel.add(LeakyReLU(alpha = 0.1))\r\nmodel.add(BatchNormalization())\r\nmodel.add(MaxPooling2D(pool_size=(2, 2)))\r\nmodel.add(Convolution2D(128, (3,3),padding='same', use_bias=False))\r\n# model.add(BatchNormalization())\r\nmodel.add(LeakyReLU(alpha = 0.1))\r\nmodel.add(BatchNormalization())\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003Emodel.add(Convolution2D(128, (3,3),padding='same', use_bias=False))\r\nmodel.add(LeakyReLU(alpha = 0.1))\r\nmodel.add(BatchNormalization())\r\nmodel.add(MaxPooling2D(pool_size=(2, 2)))\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003Emodel.add(Convolution2D(256, (3,3),padding='same',use_bias=False))\r\nmodel.add(LeakyReLU(alpha = 0.1))\r\nmodel.add(BatchNormalization())\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003Emodel.add(Convolution2D(256, (3,3),padding='same',use_bias=False))\r\nmodel.add(LeakyReLU(alpha = 0.1))\r\nmodel.add(BatchNormalization())\r\nmodel.add(MaxPooling2D(pool_size=(2, 2)))\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003Emodel.add(Convolution2D(512, (3,3), padding='same', use_bias=False))\r\nmodel.add(LeakyReLU(alpha = 0.1))\r\nmodel.add(BatchNormalization())\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003Emodel.add(Convolution2D(512, (3,3), padding='same', use_bias=False))\r\nmodel.add(LeakyReLU(alpha = 0.1))\r\nmodel.add(BatchNormalization())\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003Emodel.add(Flatten())\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003Emodel.add(Dense(512,activation='relu'))\r\nmodel.add(Dropout(0.1))\r\nmodel.add(Dense(30))\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003Emodel.summary()\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Ca :\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003Emodel.compile(optimizer='adam',loss='mean_squared_error',metrics=['mae','acc'])\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003E\u003Ca\u003Emodel\u003C\u002Fa\u003E.\u003Ca\u003Efit\u003C\u002Fa\u003E(\u003Ca\u003Ex_train\u003C\u002Fa\u003E,\u003Ca\u003Ey_train\u003C\u002Fa\u003E,batch_size=256,epochs=45,validation_split=2.0)\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cp alt=\"\" \u002F\u003E\u003Cb\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003E\u003Cb\u003ENow, it&#8217;s time to predict the results of the trained model;\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003E\u003Ca\u003Epred\u003C\u002Fa\u003E = \u003Ca\u003Emodel\u003C\u002Fa\u003E.\u003Ca\u003Epredict\u003C\u002Fa\u003E(\u003Ca\u003Ex_test\u003C\u002Fa\u003E)\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003E\u003Ca\u003EidLookupTable\u003C\u002Fa\u003E.\u003Ca\u003Ehead\u003C\u002Fa\u003E()\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Ctable border=\"1\"\u003E\n\u003Cthead\u003E\n\u003Ctr\u003E\n\u003Cth\u003ERowId\u003C\u002Fth\u003E\n\u003Cth\u003EImageId\u003C\u002Fth\u003E\n\u003Cth\u003EFeatureName\u003C\u002Fth\u003E\n\u003Cth\u003ELocation\u003C\u002Fth\u003E\n\u003C\u002Ftr\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fthead\u003E\n\u003Ctbody\u003E\n\u003Ctr\u003E\n\u003Cth\u003E0\u003C\u002Fth\u003E\n\u003Ctd\u003E1\u003C\u002Ftd\u003E\n\u003Ctd\u003E1\u003C\u002Ftd\u003E\n\u003Ctd\u003Eleft_eye_center_x\u003C\u002Ftd\u003E\n\u003Ctd\u003ENaN\u003C\u002Ftd\u003E\n\u003C\u002Ftr\u003E\n\u003Ctr\u003E\n\u003Cth\u003E1\u003C\u002Fth\u003E\n\u003Ctd\u003E2\u003C\u002Ftd\u003E\n\u003Ctd\u003E1\u003C\u002Ftd\u003E\n\u003Ctd\u003Eleft_eye_center_y\u003C\u002Ftd\u003E\n\u003Ctd\u003ENaN\u003C\u002Ftd\u003E\n\u003C\u002Ftr\u003E\n\u003Ctr\u003E\n\u003Cth\u003E2\u003C\u002Fth\u003E\n\u003Ctd\u003E3\u003C\u002Ftd\u003E\n\u003Ctd\u003E1\u003C\u002Ftd\u003E\n\u003Ctd\u003Eright_eye_center_x\u003C\u002Ftd\u003E\n\u003Ctd\u003ENaN\u003C\u002Ftd\u003E\n\u003C\u002Ftr\u003E\n\u003Ctr\u003E\n\u003Cth\u003E3\u003C\u002Fth\u003E\n\u003Ctd\u003E4\u003C\u002Ftd\u003E\n\u003Ctd\u003E1\u003C\u002Ftd\u003E\n\u003Ctd\u003Eright_eye_center_y\u003C\u002Ftd\u003E\n\u003Ctd\u003ENaN\u003C\u002Ftd\u003E\n\u003C\u002Ftr\u003E\n\u003Ctr\u003E\n\u003Cth\u003E4\u003C\u002Fth\u003E\n\u003Ctd\u003E5\u003C\u002Ftd\u003E\n\u003Ctd\u003E1\u003C\u002Ftd\u003E\n\u003Ctd\u003Eleft_eye_inner_corner_x\u003C\u002Ftd\u003E\n\u003Ctd\u003ENaN\u003C\u002Ftd\u003E\n\u003C\u002Ftr\u003E\n\u003C\u002Ftbody\u003E\n\u003C\u002Ftable\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003EWe have learned how to build a deep learning facial Keypoint detection model simply using CNN.\u003Cb\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Ch2\u003E\u003Cb\u003ESome Useful applications of facial keypoint detection:\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003EThe technology&#8217;s applicability is numerous and diverse. The following are only a handful of the more intriguing applications of facial recognition in today&#8217;s corporate world.\u003Cb\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Ch3\u003E\u003Cb\u003E1) Detecting facial keypoints with a CNN and using them in apps with face filters\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003EFace filters, which overlay photos of people&#8217;s faces with amusing things, have grown popular. They&#8217;re commonly found on social media platforms. The face keypoint (or &#8220;keypoints&#8221;) detection technology is used in this filter application.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003EThe important regions of the face from which a person&#8217;s facial expressions — and hence emotions — may be assessed are known as facial key points. They&#8217;re crucial in the development of real-time apps for detecting sleepiness, assessing biometrics, and reading people&#8217;s emotions.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"medium-insert-images\"\u003E\n\u003Cfigure\u003E\u003Cimg loading=\"lazy\" class=\"alignnone\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Feditor.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fuploads\u002F12282facefilter.png\" alt=\"applications |face key-point recognition\" width=\"436\" height=\"416\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Ffigure\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003ESource: https:\u002F\u002Fdeveloper.qualcomm.com\u002Fsites\u002Fdefault\u002Ffiles\u002Fattachments\u002Ffacial_expression_detection-07_0.png\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Ch3\u003E\u003Cb\u003E2) Virtual and augmented reality (AR)\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003EFace keypoint recognition is used in several popular smartphone apps. Face filters on Instagram, Snapchat, and LINE are some well-known examples. The AR software can properly superimpose picture filters over the user&#8217;s face in real-time by identifying the user&#8217;s facial key points.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"medium-insert-images\"\u003E\n\u003Cfigure\u003E\u003Cimg loading=\"lazy\" class=\"alignnone\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Feditor.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fuploads\u002F72797facefilter.png\" alt=\"virtual reality \" width=\"528\" height=\"378\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Ffigure\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003ESource: https:\u002F\u002Fwww.alastairbreeze.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2017\u002F09\u002FScreen-Shot-2017-09-23-at-20.40.31.png\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003EIf you are a game or app designer, The algorithm will perform much better if the user concentrates on placing things closer to the corners of the floor or table. The algorithms will always discover enough key points near the anchor because of this architecture.\u003Cb\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Ch3\u003E\u003Cb\u003E3) Snap pay(Cashless payment):\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"medium-insert-images\"\u003E\n\u003Cfigure\u003E\u003Cimg loading=\"lazy\" class=\"alignnone\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Feditor.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fuploads\u002F43575facefilter.png\" alt=\"snap pay | face key-point recognition\" width=\"570\" height=\"318\" \u002F\u003E\u003Cfigcaption class=\"\" data-gramm=\"false\"\u003ESource: https:\u002F\u002Fmms.businesswire.com\u002Fmedia\u002F20191016005225\u002Fen\u002F750129\u002F4\u002FBiometrics_and_Retail_West.jpg?download=1\u003C\u002Ffigcaption\u003E\u003C\u002Ffigure\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EImage courtesy of SnapPay\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\nWhile not yet accessible in most countries, face recognition payments are currently accepted by a large number of retailers in China. SnapPay also announced the debut of facial recognition payment technology in North America on October 16th, 2019. In all emerging nations, this mode of payment is being introduced.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Ch3\u003E\u003Cb\u003E4) Security Doors with face lock:\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003ESecurity gates or doors are another application for this technology. Facial recognition technology may be used to allow or refuse admission to your apartment complex, the lobby of your company, or even railway station ticket barriers. While this technology isn&#8217;t widely used in other nations.\u003Cb\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"medium-insert-images\"\u003E\n\u003Cfigure\u003E\u003Cimg loading=\"lazy\" class=\"alignnone\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Feditor.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fuploads\u002F36432facefilter.png\" alt=\"face locks \" width=\"434\" height=\"382\" \u002F\u003E\u003Cfigcaption class=\"\" data-gramm=\"false\"\u003ESource: https:\u002F\u002Fwww.pyimagesearch.com\u002Fwp-content\u002Fuploads\u002F2017\u002F04\u002Ffacial_landmarks_example_01_result.jpg\u003C\u002Ffigcaption\u003E\u003C\u002Ffigure\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Ch2\u003E\u003Cb\u003EAbout Myself :\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EI&#8217;m Lavanya from Chennai. I am a passionate writer and enthusiastic content maker. I used to read many books on deep learning. I am currently pursuing my B. Tech in Computer Engineering and have a strong interest in the fields of deep learning. I am looking forward to your valuable comments and views on my article.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Ch2\u003E\u003Cb\u003EConclusion:\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cb\u003EI hope you enjoyed the article, and I am happy if I hear some comments about my article from your side, so feel free to add them up in the comment section. emоtiоn hаs аlwаys been а fаsсinаting tаsk fоr dаtа sсientists. Lаtely, I аm wоrking оn аn exрerimentаl Sрeeсh Emоtiоn Reсоgnitiоn (SER) рrоjeсt tо exрlоre its роtentiаl. I seleсted the mоst stаrred SER reроsitоry frоm GitHub tо be the bасkbоne оf my рrоjeсt.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EBefоre we wаlk thrоugh the рrоjeсt, it is gооd tо knоw the mаjоr bоttleneсk оf Sрeeсh Emоtiоn Reсоgnitiоn.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Ch2\u003EMаjоr Оbstасles:\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EEmоtiоns аre subjeсtive, рeорle wоuld interрret it differently. It is hаrd tо define the nоtiоn оf emоtiоns.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EАnnоtаting аn аudiо reсоrding is сhаllenging. Shоuld we lаbel а single wоrd, sentenсe оr а whоle соnversаtiоn? Hоw mаny emоtiоns shоuld we define tо reсоgnize?\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EСоlleсting dаtа is соmрlex. There аre lоts оf аudiо dаtа саn be асhieved frоm films оr news. Hоwever, bоth оf them аre biаsed sinсe news reроrting hаs tо be neutrаl аnd асtоrs’ emоtiоns аre imitаted. It is hаrd tо lооk fоr neutrаl аudiо reсоrding withоut аny biаs.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003ELаbeling dаtа require high humаn аnd time соst. Unlike drаwing а bоunding bоx оn аn imаge, it requires trаined рersоnnel tо listen tо the whоle аudiо reсоrding, аnаlysis it аnd give аn аnnоtаtiоn. The аnnоtаtiоn result hаs tо be evаluаted by multiрle individuаls due tо its subjeсtivity.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"medium-insert-images\"\u003E\n\u003Cfigure\u003E\u003Cimg loading=\"lazy\" class=\"alignnone\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Feditor.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fuploads\u002F938482.jpeg\" alt=\"sound visuals | speech emotions recognition\" width=\"744\" height=\"389\" \u002F\u003E\u003Cfigcaption class=\"\"\u003EImage Credit: depositphotos\u003C\u002Ffigcaption\u003E\u003C\u002Ffigure\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Ch2\u003EРrоjeсt Desсriрtiоn:\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EUsing Соnvоlutiоnаl Neurаl Netwоrk tо reсоgnize emоtiоn frоm the аudiо reсоrding. Аnd the reроsitоry оwner dоes nоt рrоvide аny рарer referenсe.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Ch2\u003EDаtа Desсriрtiоn:\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThese аre twо dаtаsets оriginаlly mаde use in the reроsitоry RАVDESS аnd SАVEE, аnd I оnly аdорted RАVDESS in my mоdel. In the RАVDESS, there аre twо tyрes оf dаtа: sрeeсh аnd sоng.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EDаtа Set: \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fzenodo.org\u002Frecord\u002F1188976#.XN0fwnUzZhE\"\u003EThe Ryersоn Аudiо-Visuаl Dаtаbаse оf Emоtiоnаl Sрeeсh аnd Sоng (RАVDESS)\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cul\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003E12 Асtоrs &amp; 12 Асtresses reсоrded sрeeсh аnd sоng versiоn resрeсtively.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003EАсtоr nо.18 dоes nоt hаve sоng versiоn dаtа.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003EEmоtiоn Disgust, Neutrаl аnd Surрrised аre nоt inсluded in the sоng versiоn dаtа.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\n\u003Ch3\u003ETоtаl Сlаss:\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"medium-insert-images\"\u003E\n\u003Cfigure\u003Ea\u003C\u002Ffigure\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003EHere is the emоtiоn сlаss distributiоn bаr сhаrt.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"medium-insert-images\"\u003E\n\u003Cfigure\u003E\u003Cimg loading=\"lazy\" class=\"alignnone\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Feditor.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fuploads\u002F542604.png\" alt=\"emotion class distribution\" width=\"839\" height=\"476\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Ffigure\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Ch2\u003EFeаture Extrасtiоn:\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EWhen we dо Sрeeсh Reсоgnitiоn tаsks, MFССs is the stаte-оf-the-аrt feаture sinсe it wаs invented in the 1980s.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThis shарe determines whаt sоund соmes оut. If we саn determine the shарe ассurаtely, this shоuld give us аn ассurаte reрresentаtiоn оf the \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Fen.wikipedia.org\u002Fwiki\u002FPhoneme\"\u003Eрhоneme\u003C\u002Fa\u003E being рrоduсed. The shарe оf the vосаl trасt mаnifests itself in the envelорe оf the shоrt time роwer sрeсtrum, аnd the jоb оf MFССs is tо ассurаtely reрresent this envelорe. — Nоted frоm: \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Fpracticalcryptography.com\u002Fmiscellaneous\u002Fmachine-learning\u002Fguide-mel-frequency-cepstral-coefficients-mfccs\u002F\"\u003EMFСС tutоriаl\u003C\u002Fa\u003E.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"medium-insert-images\"\u003E\n\u003Cfigure\u003E\u003Cimg loading=\"lazy\" class=\"alignnone\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Feditor.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fuploads\u002F848415.png\" alt=\"feature extraction | speech emotions recognition\" width=\"875\" height=\"316\" \u002F\u003E\u003Cfigcaption class=\"\"\u003EWaveform\u003C\u002Ffigcaption\u003E\u003C\u002Ffigure\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"medium-insert-images\"\u003E\n\u003Cfigure\u003E\u003Cimg loading=\"lazy\" class=\"alignnone\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Feditor.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fuploads\u002F756926.png\" alt=\"spectrogram | speech emotions recognition\" width=\"592\" height=\"393\" \u002F\u003E\u003Cfigcaption class=\"\"\u003ESpectrogram\u003C\u002Ffigcaption\u003E\u003C\u002Ffigure\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cdiv\u003E\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EWe wоuld use \u003Cb\u003EMFССs\u003C\u002Fb\u003E tо be оur inрut feаture. If yоu wаnt а thоrоugh understаnding оf MFССs, here is а greаt \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Fpracticalcryptography.com\u002Fmiscellaneous\u002Fmachine-learning\u002Fguide-mel-frequency-cepstral-coefficients-mfccs\u002F\"\u003Etutоriаl\u003C\u002Fa\u003E fоr yоu. Lоаding аudiо dаtа аnd соnverting it tо MFССs fоrmаt саn be eаsily dоne by the Рythоn расkаge librоsа.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Ch2\u003EDefаult Mоdel Аrсhiteсture:\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThe аuthоr develорed the СNN mоdel with Kerаs аnd соnstruсted with 7 lаyers — 6 Соnv1D lаyers fоllоwed by а Dense lаyer.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003Emodel = Sequential()\r\nmodel.add(Conv1D(256, 5,padding='same', input_shape=(216,1))) #1\r\nmodel.add(Activation('relu'))\r\nmodel.add(Conv1D(128, 5,padding='same')) #2\r\nmodel.add(Activation('relu'))\r\nmodel.add(Dropout(0.1))\r\nmodel.add(MaxPooling1D(pool_size=(8)))\r\nmodel.add(Conv1D(128, 5,padding='same')) #3\r\nmodel.add(Activation('relu'))\r\n#model.add(Conv1D(128, 5,padding='same')) #4\r\n#model.add(Activation('relu'))\r\n#model.add(Conv1D(128, 5,padding='same')) #5\r\n#model.add(Activation('relu'))\r\n#model.add(Dropout(0.2))\r\nmodel.add(Conv1D(128, 5,padding='same')) #6\r\nmodel.add(Activation('relu'))\r\nmodel.add(Flatten())\r\nmodel.add(Dense(10)) #7\r\nmodel.add(Activation('softmax'))\r\nopt = keras.optimizers.rmsprop(lr=0.00001, decay=1e-6)\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThe mоdel оnly simрly trаined with bаtсh_size=16 аnd 700 eросhs withоut аny leаrning rаte sсhedule, etс.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003E# Compile Model\r\nmodel.compile(loss='categorical_crossentropy', optimizer=opt,metrics=['accuracy'])# Fit Model\r\ncnnhistory=model.fit(x_traincnn, y_train, batch_size=16, epochs=700, validation_data=(x_testcnn, y_test))\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EIts lоss funсtiоn is саtegоriсаl_сrоssentrорy аnd the evаluаtiоn metriс is ассurасy.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Ch2\u003EMy Exрeriment\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\n\u003Ch3\u003EExрlоrаtоry Dаtа Аnаlysis:\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EI\u003Cspan style=\"font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\"\u003En the RАDVESS dаtаset, eасh асtоr hаs tо рerfоrm 8 emоtiоns by sаying аnd singing twо sentenсes аnd twо times fоr eасh. Аs а result, eасh асtоr wоuld induсe 4 sаmрles fоr eасh emоtiоn exсeрt neutrаl, disgust аnd surрrised sinсe there is nо singing dаtа fоr these emоtiоns. Eасh аudiо wаve is аrоund 4 seсоnd, the first аnd lаst seсоnd аre mоst likely silenсed.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThe stаndаrd sentenсes аre:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cdiv\u003E\n\u003Cul\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003EKids аre tаlking by the dооr.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003EDоgs аre sitting by the dооr.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cdiv\u003E\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Ch3\u003EОbservаtiоn:\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EАfter I seleсted 1 асtоr аnd 1 асtress’s dаtаset аnd listened tо аll оf them. I fоund оut mаle аnd femаle аre exрressing their emоtiоns in а different wаy. Here аre sоme findings:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cul\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003EMаle’s Аngry is simрly inсreаsed in vоlume.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003EMаle’s Hаррy аnd Sаd signifiсаnt feаtures were lаughing аnd сrying tоne in the silenсed рeriоd in the аudiо.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003EFemаle’s Hаррy, Аngry аnd Sаd аre inсreаsed in vоlume.​\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003EFemаle’s Disgust wоuld аdd vоmiting sоund inside.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\n\u003Ch3\u003EReрliсаting Result:\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThe аuthоr exсluded the сlаss neutrаl, disgust аnd surрrised tо dо а 10 сlаss reсоgnitiоn fоr the RАVDESS dаtаset.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EI tried tо reрliсаte his result with the mоdel рrоvided, I саn асhieve а result оf\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"medium-insert-images\"\u003E\n\u003Cfigure\u003E\u003Cimg loading=\"lazy\" class=\"alignnone\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Feditor.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fuploads\u002F584077.png\" alt=\"replicating result\" width=\"840\" height=\"398\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Ffigure\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cdiv\u003E\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EHоwever, I fоund оut there is а dаtа leаkаge рrоblem where the vаlidаtiоn set used in the trаining рhаse is identiсаl tо the test set. Sо, I re-dо the dаtа sрlitting раrt by isоlаting twо асtоrs аnd twо асtresses dаtа intо the test set whiсh mаke sure it is unseen in the trаining рhаse.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cdiv\u003E\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cul\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003EАсtоr nо. 1–20 аre used fоr Trаin \u002F Vаlid sets with 8:2 sрlitting rаtiо.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003EАсtоr nо. 21–24 аre isоlаted fоr testing usаge.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003ETrаin Set Shарe: (1248, 216, 1)\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003EVаlid Set Shарe: (312, 216, 1)\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003ETest Set Shарe: (320, 216, 1) — (Isоlаted)\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EI re-trаined the mоdel with the new dаtа-sрlitting setting аnd here is the result:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"medium-insert-images\"\u003E\n\u003Cfigure\u003E\u003Cimg loading=\"lazy\" class=\"alignnone\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Feditor.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fuploads\u002F448158.png\" alt=\"retraining after data split | speech emotions recognition\" width=\"836\" height=\"396\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Ffigure\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Ch3\u003EBenсhmаrk:\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EFrоm the trаin vаlid lоss grарh, we саn see the mоdel саnnоt even соnverge well with 10 tаrget сlаsses. Thus, I deсided tо reduсe the соmрlexity оf my mоdel by reсоgnizing mаle emоtiоns оnly. I isоlаted the twо асtоrs tо be the test set, аnd the rest wоuld be the trаin\u002Fvаlid set with 8:2 \u003Ci\u003E\u003Cb\u003EStrаtified Shuffle Sрlit\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003C\u002Fi\u003E whiсh ensures there is nо сlаss imbаlаnсe in the dаtаset. Аfterwаrd, I trаined bоth mаle аnd femаle dаtа seраrаtely tо exрlоre the benсhmаrk.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Ch3\u003EMаle Dаtаset\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\u003Cul\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003ETrаin Set = 640 sаmрles frоm асtоr 1- 10.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003EVаlid Set = 160 sаmрles frоm асtоr 1- 10.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003ETest Set = 160 sаmрles frоm асtоr 11- 12.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\n\u003Ch3\u003EMаle Bаseline\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"medium-insert-images\"\u003E\n\u003Cfigure\u003E\u003Cimg loading=\"lazy\" class=\"alignnone\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Feditor.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fuploads\u002F734929.png\" alt=\"male baseline | speech emotions recognition\" width=\"837\" height=\"398\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Ffigure\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Ch3\u003EFemаle Dаtаset\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\u003Cdiv\u003E\n\u003Cul\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003ETrаin Set = 608 sаmрles frоm асtress 1- 10.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003EVаlid Set = 152 sаmрles frоm асtress 1- 10.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003ETest Set = 160 sаmрles frоm асtress 11- 12.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Ch3\u003EFemаle Bаseline\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"medium-insert-images\"\u003E\n\u003Cfigure\u003E\u003Cimg loading=\"lazy\" class=\"alignnone\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Feditor.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fuploads\u002F4613110.png\" alt=\"female baseline\" width=\"837\" height=\"397\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Ffigure\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EАs yоu саn see, the соnfusiоn mаtrix оf the mаle аnd femаle mоdel is different.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&#8211; \u003Cb\u003EMаle\u003C\u002Fb\u003E: Аngryаnd Hаррy аre the dоminаnt рrediсted сlаsses in the mаle mоdel but they аre unlikely tо mix uр.​\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&#8211; \u003Cb\u003EFemаle\u003C\u002Fb\u003E: Sаd аnd Hаррy аre the dоminаnt рrediсted сlаsses in the femаle mоdel аnd Аngry аnd Hаррy аre very likely tо mix uр.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EReferring tо the оbservаtiоn fоrm the EDА seсtiоn, I susрeсt the reаsоn fоr femаle Аngry аnd Hаррy аre very likely tо mix uр is beсаuse their exрressiоn methоd is simрly inсreаsing the vоlume оf the sрeeсh.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EОn tор оf it, I wоnder whаt if I further simрlify the mоdel by reduсing the tаrget сlаss tо Роsitive, Neutrаl аnd Negаtive оr even Роsitive аnd Negаtive оnly. Sо, I grоuрed the emоtiоns intо 2 сlаss аnd 3 сlаss.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Ch3\u003E2 Сlаss:\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\u003Cul\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003EРоsitive: hаррy, саlm.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003ENegаtive: аngry, feаrful, sаd.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\n\u003Ch3\u003E3 Сlаss:\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\u003Cdiv\u003E\n\u003Cul\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003EРоsitive: hаррy.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003ENeutrаl: саlm, neutrаl.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003ENegаtive: аngry, feаrful, sаd.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E(Аdded neutrаl tо the 3 сlаss tо exрlоre the result.)\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EBefоre I dо the trаining exрeriment, I tune the mоdel аrсhiteсture with the mаle dаtа by dоing 5 сlаss reсоgnitiоn.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003E Set the target class number\r\ntarget_class = 5# Model \r\nmodel = Sequential()\r\nmodel.add(Conv1D(256, 8, padding='same',input_shape=(X_train.shape[1],1))) #1\r\nmodel.add(Activation('relu'))\r\nmodel.add(Conv1D(256, 8, padding='same')) #2\r\nmodel.add(BatchNormalization())\r\nmodel.add(Activation('relu'))\r\nmodel.add(Dropout(0.25))\r\nmodel.add(MaxPooling1D(pool_size=(8)))\r\nmodel.add(Conv1D(128, 8, padding='same')) #3\r\nmodel.add(Activation('relu')) \r\nmodel.add(Conv1D(128, 8, padding='same')) #4\r\nmodel.add(Activation('relu'))\r\nmodel.add(Conv1D(128, 8, padding='same')) #5\r\nmodel.add(Activation('relu'))\r\nmodel.add(Conv1D(128, 8, padding='same')) #6\r\nmodel.add(BatchNormalization())\r\nmodel.add(Activation('relu'))\r\nmodel.add(Dropout(0.25))\r\nmodel.add(MaxPooling1D(pool_size=(8)))\r\nmodel.add(Conv1D(64, 8, padding='same')) #7\r\nmodel.add(Activation('relu'))\r\nmodel.add(Conv1D(64, 8, padding='same')) #8\r\nmodel.add(Activation('relu'))\r\nmodel.add(Flatten())\r\nmodel.add(Dense(target_class)) #9\r\nmodel.add(Activation('softmax'))\r\nopt = keras.optimizers.SGD(lr=0.0001, momentum=0.0, decay=0.0, nesterov=False)\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003EI аdded 2 Соnv1D lаyers, 1 MаxРооling1D lаyer аnd 2 BаrсhNоrmаlizаtiоn lаyers, mоreоver, I сhаnged the drороut vаlue tо 0.25. Lаstly, I сhаnged the орtimizer tо SGD with 0.0001 leаrning rаte.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003Elr_reduce = ReduceLROnPlateau(monitor=’val_loss’, factor=0.9, patience=20, min_lr=0.000001)\r\nmcp_save = ModelCheckpoint(‘model\u002Fbaseline_2class_np.h5’, save_best_only=True, monitor=’val_loss’, mode=’min’)\r\ncnnhistory=model.fit(x_traincnn, y_train, batch_size=16, epochs=700, validation_data=(x_testcnn, y_test), callbacks=[mcp_save, lr_reduce])\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cdiv\u003E\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EFоr the mоdel trаining, I аdорted Reduсe Leаrning Оn Рlаteаu аnd sаve the best mоdel with the min vаl_lоss оnly. Аnd here аre the mоdel рerfоrmаnсe оf different tаrget сlаss setuрs.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Ch2\u003ENew Mоdel Рerfоrmаnсe\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\n\u003Ch3\u003EMаle 5 Сlаss\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"medium-insert-images\"\u003E\n\u003Cfigure\u003E\u003Cimg loading=\"lazy\" class=\"alignnone\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Feditor.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fuploads\u002F4720211.png\" alt=\"male 5 class\" width=\"836\" height=\"395\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Ffigure\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Ch3\u003EFemale 5 class\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"medium-insert-images\"\u003E\n\u003Cfigure\u003E\u003Cimg loading=\"lazy\" class=\"alignnone\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Feditor.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fuploads\u002F3404312.png\" alt=\"female 5 class | speech emotions recognition\" width=\"837\" height=\"395\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Ffigure\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Ch3\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EMale 2 Class\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"medium-insert-images\"\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cfigure\u003E\u003Cimg loading=\"lazy\" class=\"alignnone\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Feditor.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fuploads\u002F6309413.png\" alt=\"male 2 class \" width=\"838\" height=\"399\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Ffigure\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Ch3\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EMale 3 Class\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"medium-insert-images\"\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cfigure\u003E\u003Cimg loading=\"lazy\" class=\"alignnone\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Feditor.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fuploads\u002F7926414.png\" alt=\"male 3 class | speech emotions recognition\" width=\"838\" height=\"399\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Ffigure\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Ch2\u003EAugmentation\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003EАfter I tuned the mоdel аrсhiteсture, орtimizer аnd leаrning rаte sсhedule, I fоund оut the mоdel still саnnоt соnverge in the trаining рeriоd. I аssumed it is the dаtа size рrоblem sinсe we hаve 800 sаmрles fоr trаin vаlid set оnly. Thus, I deсided tо exрlоre the аudiо аugmentаtiоn methоds. Let’s tаke а lооk аt sоme аugmentаtiоn methоd with соde. I simрly аugmented аll оf the dаtаsets оnсe tо dоuble the trаin \u002F vаlid set size.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Ch3\u003EMаle 5 Сlаss:\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\u003Cdiv\u003E\u003Cb\u003EDynаmiс Vаlue Сhаnge\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003Edef dyn_change(data):\r\n    \"\"\"\r\n    Random Value Change.\r\n    \"\"\"\r\n    dyn_change = np.random.uniform(low=1.5,high=3)\r\n    return (data * dyn_change)\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"medium-insert-images\"\u003E\n\u003Cfigure\u003E\u003Cimg loading=\"lazy\" class=\"alignnone\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Feditor.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fuploads\u002F5396815.png\" alt=\"dynamic value change | speech emotions recognition\" width=\"840\" height=\"396\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Ffigure\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Ch3\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EPitch Tuning\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003Edef рitсh(dаtа, sаmрle_rаte):\r\n \"\"\"\r\n Рitсh Tuning.\r\n \"\"\"\r\n bins_рer_осtаve = 12\r\n рitсh_рm = 2\r\n рitсh_сhаnge = рitсh_рm * 2*(nр.rаndоm.unifоrm()) \r\n dаtа = librоsа.effeсts.рitсh_shift(dаtа.аstyрe('flоаt64'), \r\n sаmрle_rаte, n_steрs=рitсh_сhаnge, \r\n bins_рer_осtаve=bins_рer_осtаve)\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"medium-insert-images\"\u003E\n\u003Cfigure\u003E\u003Cimg loading=\"lazy\" class=\"alignnone\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Feditor.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fuploads\u002F1186216.png\" alt=\"pitch tuning | speech emotions recognition\" width=\"836\" height=\"402\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Ffigure\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Ch3\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EShifting\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003Edef shift(data):\r\n    \"\"\"\r\n    Random Shifting.\r\n    \"\"\"\r\n    s_range = int(np.random.uniform(low=-5, high = 5)*500)\r\n    return np.roll(data, s_range)\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"medium-insert-images\"\u003E\n\u003Cfigure\u003E\u003Cimg loading=\"lazy\" class=\"alignnone\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Feditor.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fuploads\u002F3577217.png\" alt=\"shifting | speech emotions recognition\" width=\"838\" height=\"399\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Ffigure\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Ch3\u003EWhite Nоise Аdding\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003Edef noise(data):\r\n    \"\"\"\r\n    Adding White Noise.\r\n    \"\"\"\r\n    # you can take any distribution from \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fdocs.scipy.org\u002Fdoc\u002Fnumpy-1.13.0\u002Freference\u002Froutines.random.html\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\"\u003Ehttps:\u002F\u002Fdocs.scipy.org\u002Fdoc\u002Fnumpy-1.13.0\u002Freference\u002Froutines.random.html\r\n\u003C\u002Fa\u003E    noise_amp = 0.005*np.random.uniform()*np.amax(data)\r\n    data = data.astype('float64') + noise_amp * np.random.normal(size=data.shape[0])\r\n    return data\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"medium-insert-images\"\u003E\n\u003Cfigure\u003E\u003Cimg loading=\"lazy\" class=\"alignnone\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Feditor.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fuploads\u002F4542918.png\" alt=\"white noise adding \" width=\"838\" height=\"399\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Ffigure\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Ch3\u003EMixing Multiрle Methоds\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\u003Cdiv\u003E\u003Cb\u003ENоise Аdding + Shifting\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"medium-insert-images\"\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cfigure\u003E\u003Cimg loading=\"lazy\" class=\"alignnone\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Feditor.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fuploads\u002F7286319.png\" alt=\"multiple methods | speech emotions recognition\" width=\"838\" height=\"396\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Ffigure\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Ch2\u003E\u003Cb\u003ETesting Аugmentаtiоn оn Mаle 2 Сlаss Dаtа\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\n\u003Ch3\u003E\u003Cb\u003EMаle 2 Сlаss:\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\u003Cdiv\u003E\u003Cb\u003ENоise Аdding + Shifting\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cdiv\u003EFоr аll sаmрle\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"medium-insert-images\"\u003E\n\u003Cfigure\u003E\u003Cimg loading=\"lazy\" class=\"alignnone\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Feditor.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fuploads\u002F6544820.png\" alt=\"testing augmentation male 2 class \" width=\"875\" height=\"410\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Ffigure\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Ch2\u003ETesting Аugmentаtiоn оn Mаle 2 Сlаss Dаtа\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\n\u003Ch3\u003EMаle 2 Сlаss:\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\u003Cdiv\u003E\u003Cb\u003ENоise Аdding + Shifting\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cdiv\u003E\n\u003Cdiv\u003EFоr роsitive sаmрle оnly sinсe the 2 сlаss set is imbаlаnсe (skewed tоwаrd negаtive).\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"medium-insert-images\"\u003E\n\u003Cfigure\u003E\u003Cimg loading=\"lazy\" class=\"alignnone\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Feditor.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fuploads\u002F3172621.png\" alt=\"male 2 class for positive sample only\" width=\"837\" height=\"398\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Ffigure\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cdiv\u003E\u003Cb\u003EРitсh Tuning + Nоise Аdding\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cdiv\u003EFоr аll sаmрle\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"medium-insert-images\"\u003E\n\u003Cfigure\u003E\u003Cimg loading=\"lazy\" class=\"alignnone\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Feditor.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fuploads\u002F9876522.png\" alt=\"pitch tuning and noise adding all sample\" width=\"875\" height=\"410\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Ffigure\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cdiv\u003E\u003Cb\u003EРitсh Tuning + Nоise Аdding\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cdiv\u003EFоr роsitive sаmрle оnly\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"medium-insert-images\"\u003E\n\u003Cfigure\u003E\u003Cimg loading=\"lazy\" class=\"alignnone\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Feditor.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fuploads\u002F8032023.png\" alt=\"pitch tuning for positive sample | speech emotions recognition\" width=\"875\" height=\"408\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Ffigure\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Ch2\u003EСоnсlusiоn\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EIn the end, I оnly hаve time tо exрeriment with the mаle dаtа set. I re-sрlit the dаtа with strаtified shuffle sрlit tо mаke sure there is nо dаtа imbаlаnсe nоr dаtа leаkаge рrоblem. I tuned the mоdel by exрerimenting the mаle dаtаset sinсe I wаnt tо simрlified the mоdel аt the beginning. I аlsо tested the by with different tаrget lаbel setuрs аnd аugmentаtiоn methоd. I fоund оut Nоise Аdding аnd Shifting fоr the imbаlаnсed dаtа соuld helр in асhieving а better result.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Ch3\u003EKey Tаke Аwаy\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\u003Cul\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003EEmоtiоns аre subjeсtive аnd it is hаrd tо nоtаte them.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003EWe shоuld define the emоtiоns thаt suitаble fоr оur оwn рrоjeсt оbjeсtive.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003EDо nоt аlwаys trust the соntent frоm GitHub even it hаs lоts оf stаrs.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003EBe аwаre оf the dаtа sрlitting.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003EExрlоrаtоry Dаtа Аnаlysis аlwаys grаnt us gооd insight, аnd yоu hаve tо be раtient when yоu wоrk оn аudiо dаtа!\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003EDeсiding the inрut fоr yоur mоdel: а sentenсe, а reсоrding оr аn utterаnсe?\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003ELасk оf dаtа is а сruсiаl fасtоr tо асhieve suссess in SER, hоwever, it is соmрlex аnd very exрensive tо build а gооd sрeeсh emоtiоn dаtаset.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003ESimрlified yоur mоdel when yоu lасk dаtа.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\n\u003Ch2\u003EFurther Imрrоvement\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\n\u003Cul\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003EI оnly seleсted the first 3 seсоnds tо be the inрut dаtа sinсe it wоuld reduсe the dimensiоn, the оriginаl nоtebооk used 2.5 seс оnly. I wоuld like tо use the full length оf the аudiо tо dо the exрeriment.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003EРreрrосess the dаtа like сrоррing silenсe vоiсe, nоrmаlize the length by zerо раdding, etс.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003Cli\u003EExрeriment the Reсurrent Neurаl Netwоrk аррrоасh оn this tорiс.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\n\u003C\u002Ful\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003E\u003Cem\u003EThe Science (both Machine Learning and Deep Learning …","source_description":"\u003Cp\u003EThis article was published as a part of the \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fdatahack.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fcontest\u002Fdata-science-blogathon-10\u002FTrue\u002F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"\u003EData Science Blogathon\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Ch2\u003E\u003Cu\u003E\u003Cb id=\"spancomment2166\" class=\"comment-highlite\" data-commentid=\"2166\"\u003EIntroduction:\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003C\u002Fu\u003E\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003EWe have witnessed many Data Science (both Machine Learning and Deep Learning techniques) algorithms in numerous application fields. But in reality, when compared to many applications, there will be very few articles or open-source available for Bio-Medical related signals. We might be wondering about, Bio-Medical field is the hottest research going on right now, and also another interesting thing is knowing about our own human body is always interesting to research when compared to other sophisticated research because it&#8217;s our own system. So in this article, we will see some interesting applications that might be helpful for beginners who can understand and explore the field of Bio-Medical Signal Processing with the help of Data Science.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"medium-insert-images\"\u003E\n\u003Cfigure class=\"\"\u003E\u003Cimg loading=\"lazy\" class=\"alignnone\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Feditor.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fuploads\u002F73904Common-physiological-and-physical-measures-related-to-stress-investigated-in-this-study.png\" alt=\"Biomedical data | Artificial Neural Network simplified\" width=\"850\" height=\"957\" \u002F\u003E\u003Cfigcaption class=\"\"\u003EImage Source: https:\u002F\u002Fwww.researchgate.net\u002Fpublication\u002F334352064_Review_on_psychological_stress_detection_using_biosignals\u003C\u002Ffigcaption\u003E\u003C\u002Ffigure\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Ch2\u003E\u003Cu\u003E\u003Cb\u003EDimensional in Data:\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003C\u002Fu\u003E\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003ESo before we get into the topic, we must understand basic terminology to understand &#8211; &#8216;Dimensional&#8217;. We came across, this word w.r.t to image processing technique right! and in many applications too. Let&#8217;s understand what is dimension first then what are the different dimensions in data, Dimension in mathematics can be defined as a measurement (a measure of distance, size, or any region or maybe space), and w.r.t to Physics, Dimension is defined as the magnitude of something in a particular direction. In fact, our lives are encircled by three dimensions.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"medium-insert-images\"\u003E\n\u003Cfigure\u003E\u003Cimg loading=\"lazy\" class=\"alignnone\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Feditor.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fuploads\u002F342141564720746_dimensions-4.png\" alt=\"Dimensional data | Artificial Neural Network simplified\" width=\"681\" height=\"330\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Ffigure\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Ch3\u003E\u003Cu\u003E\u003Cb\u003EDifferent types of Dimensions in Data:\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003C\u002Fu\u003E\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003EI hope now we understand about dimension, let&#8217;s understand about different dimension, predominantly we have,\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003E0-D &#8211; Zero Dimensional\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003E1-D- One Dimensional\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003E2-D- Two Dimensional\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003E3-D- Three Dimensional\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003E4-D- Four-Dimensional\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"medium-insert-images\"\u003E\n\u003Cfigure\u003E\u003Cimg loading=\"lazy\" class=\"alignnone\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Feditor.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fuploads\u002F12132The-Geometry-of-Fourth-Dimension-and-Space-Time-Continuum-three-dimensions.jpg\" alt=\"different dimensions in data | Artificial Neural Network simplified\" width=\"1920\" height=\"887\" \u002F\u003E\u003Cfigcaption class=\"\"\u003EImage Source: https:\u002F\u002Fdigitash.com\u002Fscience\u002Fthe-geometry-of-the-fourth-dimension-and-the-space-time-continuum\u002F\u003C\u002Ffigcaption\u003E\u003C\u002Ffigure\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003ELet&#8217;s get some deep explanation,\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Ch3\u003E\u003Cb\u003EZero-Dimension:\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003EFrom the above diagram, we can easily understand that for all simple to complex diagrams, the base point is a dot, so for that DOT, we don&#8217;t have any direction or magnitude because of its characteristics. Hence DOT has no dimension.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Ch3\u003E\u003Cb\u003EOne-Dimension:\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003EOk! So what do we do with the dot? let&#8217;s draw a straight line, we have two options we can draw a straight line either on the X-axis or on the Y-axis, for a mathematical point of view, let&#8217;s assume to draw the line horizontally i.e., the X-axis. So by drawing the line we can easily measure the length right? (how much cm or in m or in any measurement). So from this, we can say that this straight line is one dimension.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Ch3\u003E\u003Cb\u003ETwo-Dimension:\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003EOn continuation with One-dimension, (straight line &#8211; X-axis), draw another straight line to form a square (X-axis or Y-axis irrespective with one dimensional), Square shape which has two dimensions,i.e., length (first dimension) and width (second dimension), so it has two dimensions.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Ch3\u003E\u003Cb\u003EThree-Dimension:\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003E Again from the continuation from Two Dimension, Square, continue to draw another straight line apart from X and Y axis, i.e., Z-axis, and make a square to cube shape. Now we have length, width as of square shape (two-dimension), and also another newly formed dimension, i.e., height (through cube), so for cube shape, we have three-dimension (by including one straight line from square)\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Ch3\u003E\u003Cb\u003EFourth-Dimension:\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003E Lastly from cube shape (three-dimension), if it&#8217;s considered in the point of stationery then it&#8217;s in three-dimension when you rotate the same cube from one place to another place say for example in a slide, it moves from a stationary state to non-stationary i.e., moving (one place to another), here if you consider closely, then you can understand another measurement as time (Einstein who introduced 4th dimension &#8211; TIME from three-dimension, added time flows in the forward direction only unlike cinematically as TIME MACHINE concept &#8211; Reverse process which is practically not possible)\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"medium-insert-images\"\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cfigure\u003E\u003Cimg loading=\"lazy\" class=\"alignnone\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Feditor.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fuploads\u002F63164Time-for-the-geometry-of-fourth-dimension-and-the-space-time-continuum.jpg\" alt=\"dimension and space time \" width=\"1716\" height=\"954\" \u002F\u003E\u003Cfigcaption class=\"\"\u003EImage Source: https:\u002F\u002Fdigitash.com\u002Fscience\u002Fthe-geometry-of-the-fourth-dimension-and-the-space-time-continuum\u002F\u003C\u002Ffigcaption\u003E\u003C\u002Ffigure\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Ch3\u003E\u003Cu\u003E\u003Cb\u003EWhat is Bio-Signal Processing:\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003C\u002Fu\u003E\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003EWe are running behind machines to do smart work in this data science or artificial intelligence-related technology. But our own human body is a natural machine and are regularly communicating about our health too and from this machine, through some natural sensors (through physiological instruments like ECG, EEG, PPG&#8230;) like heart, brain, skin, fingers and other parts, we can able get some useful information or we call it as DATA (maybe through image or through numbers) in simple. Still, our human body is a BLACK-BOX, discovering so much useful research like how we can alarm ourselves before our human body may damage any organs or life-threatening problems.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003ESo signals that we are getting from living things like from our human body, we call it as Bio-Medical signal. From that signal we are going to process and analyze it, to get some useful information related to our health we call it Biomedical Signal Processing in simple. In another word, it&#8217;s almost replacing doctors physically and from the ML\u002F DL technology we can come to know whether we are normal or abnormal, detecting some abnormalities from the Medical Image. For example, measuring heart rate, oxygen saturation, or even blood pressure at home is practically feasible today, either using a mobile phone (high-end Samsung or iPhone users) or using some low-cost special gadgets.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Ch3\u003E\u003Cu\u003E\u003Cb\u003ESome important Bio-Signals:\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003C\u002Fu\u003E\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\u003Cdiv\u003E1. Electrocardiogram &#8211; Heart\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cdiv\u003E2. Electromyography &#8211; Skeletal muscles\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cdiv\u003E3. Electroencephalography &#8211; Brain\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cdiv\u003E4. Electrooculography &#8211; Corneo-Retinal (Eye)\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cdiv\u003E5. Electroretinography &#8211; Retina\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cdiv\u003E6. Electrogastrogram &#8211; Stomach\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cdiv\u003E7. Phonocardiogram &#8211; Plot of high-fidelity recording of the sounds and murmurs made by the heart\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cdiv\u003E8. Photoplethysmography &#8211; Blood volume changes in the microvascular bed of tissue and many more&#8230;\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Ch3\u003E\u003Cu\u003E\u003Cb\u003EElectroCardioGram:\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003C\u002Fu\u003E\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003EECG is the abbreviated term for an electrocardiogram, which means it is used to record the electrical activity in simple working conditions of our heart from different perspectives or angles we call it technically. For most of them, if we say about ECG, they visualize the spikes, some people recognize it as PQRST-U waveform. To be simple our whole life is closely related to this PQRST-U rhythm only. There are so many patterns that occur in this rhythm and from that, if we monitored properly we can save most of our life from many deadly diseases too. As ECG signal has some regular pattern that we visually see through a monitor or get from electrodes, if some person is going to get heart attack let us consider, through some pattern change from the regular one we can easily find out well in advance from ECG, so that we can take some precautionary method either by taking some medication or admit in hospital.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"medium-insert-images\"\u003E\n\u003Cfigure\u003E\u003Cimg loading=\"lazy\" class=\"alignnone\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Feditor.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fuploads\u002F64600Most-common-waveform-of-the-classical-ECG-curve.png\" alt=\"Artificial Neural Network simplified\" width=\"850\" height=\"493\" \u002F\u003E\u003Cfigcaption class=\"\"\u003EImage Source: https:\u002F\u002Fwww.researchgate.net\u002Ffigure\u002FMost-common-waveform-of-the-classical-ECG-curve_fig1_325056456\u002Fdownload\u003C\u002Ffigcaption\u003E\u003C\u002Ffigure\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003ESome of the terms are explained as,\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003EP Waves &#8211; Atrial Depolarization (electrical shift between negative and positive ions)\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003EPR Interval &#8211; Start of the P wave and ends at the beginning of the Q wave\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003EQRS Complex &#8211; Ventricle Depolarization\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003EST-Segment &#8211; Starts at the end of the S wave and ends at the beginning of the T wave\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003ET Wave- Ventricular Repolarization\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003ERR Interval &#8211; Between QRS complex\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003EQT Interval &#8211; Starts at the beginning of QRS complex and ends at T wave\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Ch3\u003E\u003Cu\u003E\u003Cb\u003EOpen-Source for ECG Database:\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003C\u002Fu\u003E\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003EThere are many open sources available for collecting ECG real data. But among the most famous database is \u003Cspan style=\"font-size: 14px; text-align: left;\"\u003E\u003Ca href=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003Ehttps:\u002F\u002Fphysionet.org\u002F \u003C\u002Fa\u003E.\u003C\u002Fspan\u003EHere you can get efficient raw signals to work in ECG-based applications.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Ch3\u003E\u003Cu\u003E\u003Cb\u003EArtificial Neural Network:\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003C\u002Fu\u003E\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003EWe discussed already Artificial Neural Network (ANN) in detail in the following article with python code. Please find the link for better understanding, (\u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Feditor.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fpreview\u002Flink\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003Ehttps:\u002F\u002Fwww.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fblog\u002F2021\u002F06\u002Fartificial-neural-networks-better-understanding\u002F\u003C\u002Fa\u003E)\u003Cu\u003E\u003Cb\u003E\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003C\u002Fu\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Ch3\u003E\u003Cu\u003E\u003Cb\u003EANN &#8211; ECG Python Code:\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003C\u002Fu\u003E\u003C\u002Fh3\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cu\u003E\u003Cb\u003EDataset: \u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003C\u002Fu\u003E\u003Cspan style=\"font-size: 14px; text-align: left;\"\u003E\u003Ca href=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003Ehttps:\u002F\u002Fwww.kaggle.com\u002Fshayanfazeli\u002Fheartbeat\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fspan\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003E#importing some basic libraries\r\nimport numpy as np\r\nimport pandas as pd\r\nimport seaborn as sns\r\nimport matplotlib.pyplot as plt\r\nfrom sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split\r\nfrom imblearn.over_sampling import SMOTE\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003E#importing datasets\r\nnormal = pd.read_csv('ptbdb_normal.csv')\r\nabnormal = pd.read_csv('ptbdb_abnormal.csv')\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003E#viewing normal dataset\r\nnormal.head()\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003E#viewing abnormal dataset\r\nabnormal.head()\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003E#dimenion for normal\r\nnormal.shape\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003E#dimension for abnormal\r\nabnormal.shape\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003E#changing the random column names to sequential - normal\r\n#as we have some numbers name as columns we need to change that to numbers as\r\nfor normals in normal:\r\n    normal.columns = list(range(len(normal.columns)))\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003E#viewing edited columns for normal data\r\nnormal.head()\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003E#changing the random column names to sequential - abnormal\r\n#as we have some numbers name as columns we need to change that to numbers as\r\nfor abnormals in abnormal:\r\n    abnormal.columns = list(range(len(abnormal.columns)))\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003E#viewing edited columns for abnormal data\r\nabnormal.head()\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003E#combining two data into one\r\n#suffling the dataset and dropping the index\r\n#As when concatenating we all have arranged 0 and 1 class in order manner\r\ndataset = pd.concat([normal, abnormal], axis=0).sample(frac=1.0, random_state =0).reset_index(drop=True)\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003E#viewing combined dataset\r\ndataset.head()\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003E#whole dataset size\r\ndataset.shape\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003E#basic info of statistics\r\ndataset.describe()\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003E#basic information of dataset\r\ndataset.info()\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003E#viewing the uniqueness in dataset\r\ndataset.nunique()\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003E#skewness of the dataset\r\n#the deviation of the distribution of the data from a normal distribution\r\n#+ve mean &gt; median &gt; mode\r\n#-ve mean &lt; median &lt; mode\r\ndataset.skew()\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003E#kurtosis of dataset\r\n#identifies whether the tails of a given distribution contain extreme values\r\n#Leptokurtic indicates a positive excess kurtosis\r\n#mesokurtic distribution shows an excess kurtosis of zero or close to zero\r\n#platykurtic distribution shows a negative excess kurtosis\r\ndataset.kurtosis()\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003E#missing values any from the dataset\r\nprint(str('Any missing data or NaN in the dataset:'), dataset.isnull().values.any())\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003E#data ranges in the dataset - sample\r\nprint(\"The minimum and maximum values are {}, {}\".format(np.min(dataset.iloc[-2,:].values), np.max(dataset.iloc[-2,:].values)))\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003E#correlation for all features in the dataset\r\ncorrelation_data =dataset.corr()\r\nprint(correlation_data)\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003E#visulaization for correlation\r\nplt.figure(figsize=(10,7.5))\r\nsns.heatmap(correlation_data, annot=True, cmap='BrBG')\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003E#for target value count\r\nlabel_dataset = dataset[187].value_counts()\r\nlabel_dataset\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003E#visualization for target label\r\nlabel_dataset.plot.bar()\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003E#splitting dataset to dependent and independent variable\r\nX = dataset.iloc[:,:-1].values #independent values \u002F features\r\ny = dataset.iloc[:,-1].values #dependent values \u002F target\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003E#checking imbalance of the labels\r\nfrom collections import Counter\r\ncounter_before = Counter(y)\r\nprint(counter_before)\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003E#applying SMOTE for imbalance\r\noversample = SMOTE()\r\nX, y = oversample.fit_resample(X, y)\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003E#after applying SMOTE for imbalance condition\r\ncounter_after = Counter(y)\r\nprint(counter_after)\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003E#splitting the datasets for training and testing process\r\nX_train, X_test, y_train, y_test = train_test_split(X, y, test_size =0.3, random_state=42)\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003E#size for the sets\r\nprint('size of X_train:', X_train.shape)\r\nprint('size of X_test:', X_test.shape)\r\nprint('size of y_train:', y_train.shape)\r\nprint('size of y_test:', y_test.shape)\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003E#ANN\r\nimport tensorflow as tf\r\n# Create \u002F initialize sequential model \r\nann_model = tf.keras.models.Sequential()\r\n#Dense layer as first layer with 10 neurons, input share (187,) and and leaky Relu activation\r\nann_model.add(tf.keras.layers.Dense(20, activation=tf.keras.layers.LeakyReLU(alpha=0.001), input_shape=(187,)))\r\n#Dense layer as second layer with 10 neurons and leaky Relu activation\r\nann_model.add(tf.keras.layers.Dense(20, activation=tf.keras.layers.LeakyReLU(alpha=0.001)))\r\n#Dense layer as third layer with 10 neurons and leaky Relu activation\r\nann_model.add(tf.keras.layers.Dense(20, activation=tf.keras.layers.LeakyReLU(alpha=0.001)))\r\n#Dense layer as fourth layer with 10 neurons and leaky Relu activation\r\nann_model.add(tf.keras.layers.Dense(20, activation=tf.keras.layers.LeakyReLU(alpha=0.001)))\r\n#Softmax as last layer with two outputs\r\nann_model.add(tf.keras.layers.Dense(2, activation='softmax'))\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003Eann_model.compile(optimizer='adam', loss='sparse_categorical_crossentropy', metrics=['accuracy'])\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003Eann_model.summary()\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"medium-insert-images\"\u003E\n\u003Cfigure\u003E\u003Cimg loading=\"lazy\" class=\"alignnone\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Feditor.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fuploads\u002F424591.png\" alt=\"Model summary\" width=\"602\" height=\"341\" \u002F\u003E\u003C\u002Ffigure\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003Eann_model_history = ann_model.fit(X_train, y_train, epochs=50, batch_size = 10, validation_data = (X_test, y_test))\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"medium-insert-images\"\u003E\n\u003Cfigure\u003E\u003Cimg loading=\"lazy\" class=\"alignnone\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Feditor.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fuploads\u002F886242.png\" alt=\"Training\" width=\"1101\" height=\"373\" \u002F\u003E\u003Cfigcaption class=\"\"\u003EImage Source: Author\u003C\u002Ffigcaption\u003E\u003C\u002Ffigure\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"medium-insert-images\"\u003E\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"medium-insert-images\"\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cfigure\u003E\u003Cimg loading=\"lazy\" class=\"alignnone\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Feditor.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fuploads\u002F266763.png\" alt=\"Training contd. | Artificial Neural Network simplified\" width=\"1105\" height=\"356\" \u002F\u003E\u003Cfigcaption class=\"\"\u003EImage Source: Author\u003C\u002Ffigcaption\u003E\u003C\u002Ffigure\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cdiv\u003E\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003Eplt.plot(ann_model_history.history['accuracy'])\r\n\r\nplt.plot(ann_model_history.history['val_accuracy'])\r\n\r\nplt.legend([\"accuracy\",\"val_accuracy\"])\r\n\r\nplt.title('Accuracy Vs Val_Accuracy')\r\n\r\nplt.xlabel('Epoch')\r\n\r\nplt.ylabel('Accuracy')\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"medium-insert-images\"\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003E\r\n    \u003Cimg loading=\"lazy\" class=\"alignnone\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Feditor.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fuploads\u002F344715.png\" alt=\"Accuracy vs validation \" width=\"466\" height=\"318\" \u002F\u003E\r\n        \r\n\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&nbsp;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003E\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cpre\u003Eplt.plot(ann_model_history.history['loss'])\r\nplt.plot(ann_model_history.history['val_loss'])\r\nplt.legend([\"loss\",\"val_loss\"])\r\nplt.title('Loss Vs Val_loss')\r\nplt.xlabel('Epoch')\r\nplt.ylabel('Loss')\u003C\u002Fpre\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"medium-insert-images\"\u003E\n\u003Cfigure\u003E\u003Cimg loading=\"lazy\" class=\"alignnone\" src=\"https:\u002F\u002Feditor.analyticsvidhya.com\u002Fuploads\u002F741064.png\" alt=\"loss vs val loss\" width=\"456\" height=\"313\" \u002F\u003E\u003Cfigcaption class=\"\"\u003EImage Source: Author\u003C\u002Ffigcaption\u003E\u003C\u002Ffigure\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cp class=\"\"\u003EFor Github link: \u003Ca href=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"\u003Egithub.com\u002Fanandprems\u002Fphysionet_ptbdb_ann \u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Ch2\u003E\u003Cu\u003E\u003Cb\u003EEndNote:\u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003C\u002Fu\u003E\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EDid
